title: Principal Test Software Engineer/TPS Developer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description See what you're missing. Our employees work on the world's most advanced electronics - from detecting threats for F-35 pilots to illuminating the night for soldiers. Spanning air, land, sea, and space, we are developing the technology of tomorrow, delivered today. Drawing strength from our differences, we're innovating for the future. And you can, too. Our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first - exemplified by our mission: "We Protect Those Who Protect Us®." Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems. BAE Systems is looking for an experienced Test Engineer for our Integrated Test Engineering (ITE). The ITE organization's mission is to reliably deliver customer-focused, affordable test solutions which are integrated across all levels of production test. Experience the entire life cycle of a program to include bid and proposal, advanced development and demonstration, test design and development, product fielding, procurement, and sustainment. Are you an experienced Electrical, Software or Test Design Engineer with 8+ years of experience looking for the next step to grow your career? Do you want to design and develop test solutions and/or write test software that is mission critical and be a part of a greater cause? Then, help us protect those that protect us by developing the Next Generation Electronic Warfare Systems Products and Solutions. We need your talent, motivation, and vision to join our New Hampshire based team. BAE Systems has recently been awarded new programs and is currently undergoing an exciting period of growth. We have multiple positions in Southern New Hampshire (our locations include Nashua, Hudson, Merrimack, and Manchester). The selected candidate will be part of a test engineering team throughout the product lifecycle and you will motivate and inspire the engineering team across geographical boundaries to achieve more than they believe is possible! When you become a member of our team, you will work across multiple disciplines and collaborate with Systems, Hardware, Operations, Production, and Test Engineers to impact all phases of the Product Development and sustainment Lifecycle. At BAE Systems, we promote a strong, collaborative culture and provide our employees with the tools, skills and training they need to succeed. We are all about trust, camaraderie, and a shared ambition to lead the world in defense technologies and national security services. We offer a flexible work environment and 9/80 work schedule. Our company is part of the community and driven to improve our future and protect our freedom. The ideal candidate must be a motivated self-starter, able to complete assignments with little oversight while being available as a subject matter expert and technical lead to their team. They must be able to assume a full or partial lead role as circumstances dictate and be able to quickly and dynamically switch focus to accommodate the daily activities of an engineering team supporting a production environment. This individual should be comfortable providing accurate technical status to program management or direction to individual contributors as part of their job function, as well as interfacing with other engineering disciplines as necessary. The Test Engineer should have a strong background in Software, Electrical or Computer Engineering, and possess a demonstrated ability in designing, developing, debugging, integrating, and deploying complex automated test systems, test applications, documentation, and Commercial Instrumentation for testing Military Comms, Navigation, and Electronic Warfare equipment. Because this role involves a combination of collaborative/in-person and independent work, it will take the form of a hybrid work format, with time split between working onsite and remotely. Required Education, Experience, & Skills * An Active US Secret Clearance is required for this position. * Experienced in architecting, designing, analyzing/deriving requirements, coding and code modification, integration, and sell-off of test software for analog, digital, RF, and hybrid modules at board level, system level, and subsystems level using commercial and custom test measurement equipment. Experience in C/C#, National Instrument (NI) Test Stand, Python, and CVI software development environments. Experience in evaluating and debugging test solution to identify product design flaws. Experience in developing instrument drivers, utilities, test executives, and test software used to support testing and verification activities for system development, production, and sustainment testing activities. Experience in developing documentation for test requirements, test design, test plan, and operating procedures for acceptance test and environmental stress screening applications. Experienced in using test instrumentation such as Network Analyzer, Spectrum Analyzer, Signal Generators, Microwave/RF measurements etc. Familiar with basic RF testing concepts such as VSWR, Gain, Compression, Phase Noise etc. Experience in HW debugging (test adapters, cables, tools, and interface modules) Motivated, self-starter, good communication skills, team player, and "can-do" attitude. Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills * Experience in factory production test stands, problem isolation and resolution. Experienced in developing RF test measurements for production. Familiar with boundary scan tools and software Familiar with FPGA programming and debugging. title: Senior Software Engineer (On-Site) with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description Because this role involves integration and test in a classified lab for the next 2 years, work will need to be performed on-site. There will be an option for flight and ground test at customer sites if desired. After this integration effort is complete there will be options for hybrid work, involving a combination of collaborative/in-person and independent work, with time split between working onsite and remotely. Do you want to design and write software that really matters and be a part of a cause greater than yourself? Then, help us protect those that protect us by developing Next Generation Electronic Systems Products and Solutions. We need your talent, motivation, and vision as a Senior Software Engineer to join our New Hampshire team. We are actively seeking experienced Software Engineers with a minimum of four years of experience and a range of skills. The Software Engineer will apply her/his skills to developing high-quality, real-time embedded software for fielded electronics platforms. BAE Systems in NH is currently undergoing an exciting period of growth. When you become a member of our team, you will work across multiple disciplines and collaborate with Systems, Hardware and Test Engineers to impact all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle. At BAE Systems, we promote a strong, collaborative culture and provide our employees with the tools, skills and training they need to succeed. We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment and 9/80 work schedule. Our company is part of the community, and driven to improve our future and protect our freedom. You will be evaluating complex software designs to identify design flaws. You will be preparing design documentation, in accordance with established processes. You will utilize either a Linux or Windows based software development environment. Embedded targets could range from ARM through high performance x86-64 CPUs and Graphics Processing Units (GPUs). You will be integrating and testing in the selected target test environments. You may participate in external project interactions with other companies * Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires US citizenship status. title: Sr. Data Analyst

It is a journey that goes around the world serving financial institutions and companies in more than 90 countries. Our Portsmouth office is the central strategic hub in the US as well as one of the go-to market global centers of excellence, conveniently positioned to enable a fulfilling and flexible, hybrid work-life balance. A place to collaborate and share knowledge share across multidisciplinary teams, it also provides the perfect space to meet virtually with our colleagues across time zones.Culture and ValuesWe are one global team, who work with and for each other in a drive to delight customers through excellent execution, which fuels how we create and grow sustained business value for our customers, our team and all who partner with us. BI or a similar tool business intelligence tool such as Tableau or other.Proficiency in Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.Professional experience working with SQL is RequiredProven ability to drive data-driven insights and actions in an ambiguous, evolving environment.Ability to clearly and concisely articulate complex data analyses to non-technical stakeholdersStrong written and verbal communication skillsExperience with financial reporting.Advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence tools, with experience effectively defining data requirements and designing effective interactive dashboardsAbility to quickly learn and apply new analytical technologies.Developing with PowerBI is a PLUSExperience with Salesforce.com or Snowflake a PLUSHow you'll contribute:Define, build, and track key performance indicators and metrics for Customer Operations team including finance/revenue, product adoption, customer support, and customer success.Support leadership and end users with KPIs, activity tracking, and dashboards in Salesforce.com, Snowflake and PowerBI.Work closely with data engineers and internal systems to define data requirements, build analyses, and develop a single source of truth for reporting.Own delivery of analytic projects, ensuring that projects are delivered on-time with high quality.Utilize statistical techniques and analytical skills to collect, organize, analyze, and visualize data.Convert quantitative analysis into recommendations to business stakeholders.Develop dashboards and frameworks to monitor business performance and KPIs.Mentor and train internal team members on reporting, analysis, and business intelligence tools.Locate, define, and recommend process improvement opportunities to improve data quality.Understand the concepts of machine learning and advance analytics to collaborate with Data Scientists to complete new projects.You'll love Botttomline because in everything we do we seek to delight our customers and we are passionate about building a company of which we can all be proud, and this starts with building amazing teams filled with team members that challenge you every day.We welcome talent at all phases of their career through understanding and supporting additional needs (where applicable) as we look to innovate, win, and grow together.Bottomline is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. title: Digital TPS Developer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description Because this role involves a combination of collaborative/in-person and independent work, it will take the form of a hybrid work format, with time split between working onsite and remotely. See what you're missing. Our employees work on the world's most advanced electronics - from detecting threats for F-35 pilots to illuminating the night for soldiers. Spanning air, land, sea, and space, we are developing the technology of tomorrow, delivered today. Drawing strength from our differences, we're innovating for the future. And you can, too. Our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first - exemplified by our mission: "We Protect Those Who Protect Us®." Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems. Electronic Combat Solutions (ECS) has technology, engineering and program teams that educate and mentor colleagues to deliver leading Electronic Warfare capabilities. We welcome all those who have big ideas, crave innovation, want to drive fielding velocity, and have the passion to bring the warfighter home safe. When you become a member of our team, you will work across multiple disciplines and collaborate with Systems, Hardware and Test Engineers to impact all phases of the Product Development Lifecycle. At BAE Systems, we promote a strong, collaborative culture and provide our employees with the tools, skills and training they need to succeed. We are all about trust, camaraderie and a shared ambition to lead the world in defense technologies and national security services. We offer a flexible work environment and 9/80 work schedule. Our company is part of the community, and driven to improve our future and protect our freedom. Are you an experienced Electrical, Software or Test Design Engineer with 2+ years of experience looking for the next step to grow your career? Do you want to design and develop test solutions and/or write test software that is mission critical and be a part of a greater cause? Then, help us protect those that protect us by developing the Next Generation Electronic Warfare Systems Products and Solutions. We need your talent, motivation, and vision to join our New Hampshire based team. BAE Systems has recently been awarded new programs and is currently undergoing an exciting period of growth. We have multiple positions in Southern New Hampshire (our locations include Nashua, Hudson, Merrimack and Manchester). BAE Systems is searching for a RF Principal Test Engineer with experience in developing automated test software solutions. The ideal candidate would be a motivated self-starter, able to work individually or as part of a team, willing to take direction and be able to communicate effectively. The ideal candidate would be familiar or experienced in: NI Test Software Tools TestStand LabWindows/CVI Software LabView FPGA JTAG/Boundary Scan Logic Types/Communication Protocols MLVDS RS422/485 RS232 PCI/PCIe I2C/SPI Proficiency in C# is desirable Please note that pursuant to a government contract, the specific positions requires US citizenship status. Required Education, Experience, & Skills * NI TestStand - TPS Development, Test Executive Development NI LabWindows/CVI - Utility and Functional Layer Development, GUI Development Understanding of tools like Xilinx, JTAG, Python Understanding of different logic types/protocols - TTL, LVDS, RS422/485, RS232, etc. Hands on debugging/integration experience with lab instrumentation: power supplies, o-scopes, function generator, logic analyzers Knowledge of digital signal processing, statistics, repeatability and correlation analysis a plus Experience with generating/reading/editing Schematics Possess a demonstrated ability in designing, developing, and deploying Test Solutions using NI TestStand and NI LabWindows/CVI applications Possess a demonstrated ability in developing instrument drivers, utilities, and executables used to support testing Software/Test Equipment Integration and Troubleshooting skills Strong problem-solving and analytic skills Self-learner and creative Ability to engage constructively with peers and technical lead to communicate technical approach, trade-offs, and technical decisions Ability to assess test software for reuse potential Effective communication skills, both verbal and written Highly motivated and able to work well in both team and solo settings Experience utilizing configuration management tools Experience in developing software documentation for test requirements, test design, and procedures * * * Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills * Experience in supporting factory production test stands, debug, problem isolation, and resolution. Experienced in developing solutions that transmit/receive communication signals from UUTs in a myriad of different protocols for production test Ability to perform test solution development: Hardware Focus (test adapters, cables, tools, and interface modules) Software Focus (drivers, utilities, executives, and test software) Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $73370 - $124740 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team-making a big impact on a global scale. title: Experienced Model-Based Systems Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description See what you're missing. Our employees work on the world's most advanced electronics -from detecting threats for F-35 pilots to illuminating the night for soldiers. Spanning air, land, sea, and space, we are developing the technology of tomorrow, delivered today. Drawing strength from our differences, we're innovating for the future. And you can, too. Our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first -exemplified by our mission: "We Protect Those Who Protect Us®." Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems. Our engineers are the lifeblood of our company and we're more than 5,000 strong. With our robust offering of educational and career development opportunities, your chances to grow are limitless. BAE Systems' Model Based Engineering Capability Group (MBE CG) is seeking an experienced Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) professional versed in the philosophy and practice of MBSE. The MBE CG is responsible for promulgating Agile-MBSE practices, MBSE training, technically assisting all ES Sector programs in their MBSE model development and the proper application of MBSE process and technique to programs. BAE Systems is transitioning towards a Digital Enterprise (DE) where virtual and Cloud based networks and services are replacing traditional desktop applications and the MBE CG is playing a key role. As a MBSE subject matter expert (SME), this individual must have strong knowledge MBSE processes, practices, tools and related modeling languages and frameworks (e.g. SysML, UML, UAF, etc.) and understand how to build and apply models to solve complex technical problems. The candidate must also have the technical MBSE skills necessary to be capable of successfully guiding a program in their total MBSE activities from developing modeling strategies to using tools to generate model artifacts. It is expected that this individual will collaborate daily with the project design and development teams to execute the model strategy and provide OJT on MBSE methodologies and tools. Internal to the MBE CG group itself, this individual is expected to be a major contributor to the development of MBSE training materials and company MBSE best process and practices. Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We take pride in important work-life balance initiatives including every other Friday Off, Flextime, and Telecommuting. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. Because of the need for consistent, in-person collaboration and/or the requirement to perform all work onsite due to the nature of this particular role, it will be performed fulltime on site. This means work will be conducted on location at a BAE Systems facility 100% of the time. * Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires US citizenship status* Required Education, Experience, & Skills * Bachelors Degree or higher in Systems Engineering or related field 3+ Years building models using MBSE methodologies, best practices and tools 8+ years practicing Systems Engineering Subject matter expertise of UML and/or SysML Subject matter expertise with MagicDraw and associated Cameo plug-ins Created validation rules and specialized searches in the model database Demonstrate ability to analyze complex problems through MBSE models Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills * Working knowledge of Cloud technologies and platform services, e.g. AWS, Azure, etc. Directly built 5 + full scale models including parametric functions and simulation execution Fully versed in all MBSE tools and related tools Experienced in Modeling Simulation Visualization and Analysis (MSVA) Experienced in systems performance analysis (Monte Carle, Multivariate, Pareto, etc.) Experienced working in all phases of the engineering product development lifecycle Classroom teaching experience Training material development Electronic Attack & Countermeasures domain knowledge Active Secret clearance Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $140690 - $239140 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. title: 35F Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionOn the battlefield, success depends on accurate and timely intel. As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of information gathered from or about the threat. Intelligence Analysts provide Guard personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action. You'll gain Military Intelligence training, education, and a security clearance that could open doors to rewarding career opportunities with other intelligence agencies.Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparing all-source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-referencing intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and preparing and maintaining enemy situational graphics.Job DutiesPreparing all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssessing the significance and reliability of incoming intelligence collectionEstablishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and filesSome Of The Skills You'll LearnCritical thinkingThe ability to use sophisticated mapping tools, intelligence networks, and systems to identify the evolving threat on the battlefieldGather information utilizing premier digital and analytical tools to create products for the CommanderHelpful SkillsAnalytical thinking; gathering information, and understanding of relevancyInterest in reading maps and chartsMore than any other branch of service, the Army National Guard offers a wide range of intelligence-related positions. Through your training, you will develop skills and experience to create opportunities for a civilian career with federal agencies like the National Security Agency.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance and certifications. Job training for an Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. You'll learn in the classroom and gain experience in the field. Completion of your initial entry training in the Army National Guard could also lead to additional college credit.Benefits/RequirementsBenefitsPaid trainingEarn a security clearanceA monthly paycheckMontgomery GI BillFederal and State tuition assistanceRetirement benefits for part-time serviceLow-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)401(k)-type savings planStudent Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)Health care benefits availableVA home loansBonuses, if applicableMost non-prior service candidates will initially earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to change.RequirementsMilitary enlistment in the Army National GuardMust be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or GED certificateMust be between the ages of 17 and 35Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standardsMust meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)Requires military enlistment. Programs and benefits are subject to change. Ask your Army National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability.Other Job InformationJob ID: 6136ZIP Code: 3101Job Category: IntelligenceAge Requirements: Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 researcher
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: FAST Labs Sr. Principal Software Engineer (On-Site) with Security Clearance
job_description: Job DescriptionJob Description Because this role involves classified work in a closed area all work will need to be performed on site. Through research programs funded by science and technology R&D organizations within the U.S. Department of Defense, the research and development team in FAST Labs collaborate across the enterprise. On this team, you'll have the opportunity to create and develop advanced technology capabilities in the areas of advanced electronics, autonomy, cyber, electronic warfare, and sensors and processing If you are a technologist who loves to design, write, integrate, and test cutting edge software based around challenging algorithms, this is the career opportunity for you. The FAST Labs business area is the innovative research and development engine within the Electronic Systems Sector of BAE. As a Senior Principal Software Engineer in FAST Labs Engineering you might: Lead the evaluation and design of highly complex and innovative software architectures. Be the technical leader of a 5 to 10 person team. Serve as a scrum master. Mentor and train junior staff in software engineering industry best practices and process. Lead external project interactions with customers to understand their requirements and guide development efforts to meet their needs. Design, write, test, integrate, and debug software on assigned programs.Qualified candidates will also possess knowledge of software architectures, software industry best practices, and emerging software technologies. As a member of the Software Engineering Directorate, you will have opportunities to continue developing strong and increasingly complex software skills and stay current in the software discipline. The organization focuses on career development of our software engineers and advancement of the craft of software engineering. You will be working alongside other highly motivated engineers passionate about software and protecting our military service personnel. This position may require occasional U.S. domestic travel to support integration and test events. We put our customers first - exemplified by our missions: "We Protect Those Who Protect Us®" and "We Innovate For Those Who Move The WorldTM." Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems. Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires US citizenship status. Required Education, Experience, & Skills * Bachelor's Degree in a technical area with 8+ years professional SW development experience, or Master's Degree in a technical area with 6+ years professional SW development experience. Experience working with CMDA2000 Strong experience with object-oriented C++ (11 or later) Strong experience developing for and operating in the Linux Environment Experience with complex DSP environments. Experience with containerization (e.g. Docker) and developing software in containerized environments. Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills * Software architecture experience. Experience developing algorithms in MATLAB General Purpose Graphical Processing Unit (GPU) OPENCL or CUDA development. Cloud Native Technologies experience (e.g. Kubernetes, Harbor, Helm, etc.) RF, Radar, EO/IR, Electronic Warfare or Software Defined Radio experience. Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $126610 - $215270 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. title: SolutionHealth - Data Analyst III - IT - Full Time

title: 35F Intelligence Analyst
job_description: On the battlefield, success depends on accurate and timely intel. As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of information gathered from or about the threat. Intelligence Analysts provide Guard personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action. You’ll gain Military Intelligence training, education, and a security clearance that could open doors to rewarding career opportunities with other intelligence agencies.Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparing all-source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-referencing intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and preparing and maintaining enemy situational graphics.Job DutiesPreparing all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssessing the significance and reliability of incoming intelligence collectionEstablishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and filesSome Of The Skills You’ll LearnCritical thinkingThe ability to use sophisticated mapping tools, intelligence networks, and systems to identify the evolving threat on the battlefieldGather information utilizing premier digital and analytical tools to create products for the CommanderHelpful SkillsAnalytical thinking; gathering information, and understanding of relevancyInterest in reading maps and chartsMore than any other branch of service, the Army National Guard offers a wide range of intelligence-related positions. Through your training, you will develop skills and experience to create opportunities for a civilian career with federal agencies like the National Security Agency.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance and certifications. Job training for an Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. You’ll learn in the classroom and gain experience in the field. Completion of your initial entry training in the Army National Guard could also lead to additional college credit.
Industries: Government Relations Services, International Affairs, and Security and Investigations

title: Salesforce Technical Architect
job_description: Hello, Greetings from i3 infotek......! Hope you are doing great... I This is Gaurav from i3 infotek. I have some urgent requirements with one of my clients. Please go through the Job Description and let me know your interest. Below is the job Details. Title: Salesforce technical Architect  Location: Piscataway NJ  Fulltime  No C2C or Contract Job Description Owns the complete Salesforce Service Cloud Solution and Technical Architecture.  The ideal candidate has a mix of CRM processes including Architecture design and implementation experience, with an emphasis on conducting technical discussions/ workshops, and complete solution architecture definition.  Lead the team throughout the design, development, launch, and support of Salesforce.com solutions.  Develops visually rich and professional conceptual design documents targeted to varying audiences of business and technical aptitude.  Collaborate with business and IT leaders to drive the complete technical architecture including the data flow and the integration between Salesforce and other enterprise solutions.  Offer up creative ideas to help meet the business requirements, reducing the number of customizations and increasing automation.  Architect and document solution design of Salesforce solutions.  Transition solution designs to development resources responsible for building the solutions.  Provide industry leading technical expertise with Salesforce.  Help to resolve, mitigate technical/architecture issues, and risks as they arise.  Develops detailed configuration specifications documentation for ready use by the technical team  Manages customer communications, conflicts, and negotiations related to overall architecture design.  Develop Proof of Concept for specific architecture/integration concepts.  Guides customer through solution deployment.  Team player with excellent verbal & written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.  Proven experience with the Configuration/Administration of Salesforce Service Cloud.  Creating Technical requirements as an input to Salesforce solution design.  Provide guidance to clients on leading IT and Salesforce practices.  Assist technical leads in perform hands-on solution design, solution architecture, architecture roadmaps, prototyping, proof-of-concepts, and development tasks as required in support of current and new projects.  Capable of executing independent POCs to be transitioned to the scrum team for development.  Associate with Salesforce.com Certification(s) and Architecture experience responsible for the following effort  Plan and monitor technical consideration activities of the project.  Perform health check for each org and assess orgs.  Perform analysis of org configuration, customizations, and security.  Prepare Salesforce Config workbook detailing customizations and configurations or org.  Support the Project Manager in defining overall solution and strategy and document.  With gratitude  , Gaurav (David) David@msrtechnologies.com  Phone: - 781-896-2155 Ext - 126

title: Principal Systems Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description See what you're missing. Our employees work on the world's most advanced electronics - from detecting threats for F-35 pilots to illuminating the night for soldiers. Spanning air, land, sea, and space, we are developing the technology of tomorrow, delivered today. Drawing strength from our differences, we're innovating for the future. And you can, too. Our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first - exemplified by our mission: "We Protect Those Who Protect Us®." Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems. The Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) Systems Business area provides actionable intelligence for our warfighters and decision makers through innovative technical solutions from the seas to the stars. Space Systems is a premier provider of advanced high-reliability space electronics and mission systems. Our products have enabled a wide variety of civil, commercial, and national security space missions for over 25 years. We're leading the way with the development of advanced processing solutions, RF and optical payloads, and cross-domain solutions that enable our customers to deliver mission capability that was previously not achievable. As a Principal Systems Engineer in the Space System Product line, your responsibilities will include working as part of a multi-disciplinary team to create engineering solutions for airborne platforms. You will have the opportunity to support the entire systems engineering lifecycle, from requirements, architecture, design, modeling, trade studies, and Integration and test. You will support key customer milestones and work with other talented engineers to solve challenging problems to grow within this established product area. This position is based out of our Hudson NH and Merrimack NH facilities and may require collaboration with staff across our business areas and facilities in the Northeast. BAE Systems offers competitive pay, benefits, and important work-life balance initiatives including every other Friday Off, Flextime, and Telecommuting. BAE also believes in a culture of recognition for the extraordinary contributions of our skilled employees. Our engineers are the lifeblood of our company and we're more than 5,000 strong. With our robust offering of educational and career development opportunities, your chances to grow are limitless. Because of the need for consistent, in-person collaboration and/or the requirement to perform all work onsite due to the nature of this particular role, it will be performed fulltime on site. This means work will be conducted on location at a BAE Systems facility 100% of the time. * Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires US citizenship status Required Education, Experience, & Skills * Bachelor's Degree and 6 years work experience * Must currently possess a Top Secret clearance and eligible for SCI/SAP/SAR clearance Bachelor's degree in a technical area (Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math). Minimum of seven (7) years' experience defining, allocating, and validating and verifying system performance throughout the System lifecycle Knowledge and experience with the Department of Defense project life cycle Strong experience with mathematical model tools and languages; such as MATLAB, Python, etc. Able to prioritize work, multi-task and adjust to time constraint Attention to detail; possessing a drive for continuous improvement and product ownership Analytical and critical thinking skills; a creative and proactive thinker who enjoys solving complex problems Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) Experience in being part of a multidisciplinary project team Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills * Algorithm design, development and implementation experience Working knowledge of Free Space and Laser Communication Techniques for Electro-Optical (EO) Infrared (IR) Systems. Knowledge of Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) Masters in Systems Engineering Experience with Agile Methodologies and Tools Basic appreciation of emerging technology trends such as advances in information theory, control theory, machine learning, cryptology and distributed systems Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $112420 - $191070 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it's what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts - defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team-making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you'll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems' game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere - from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact - for our customers and the communities we serve. Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. title: Senior Principal System Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description Our Charter: Deter. Prevent. Detect. Respond. Our Mission: Safeguard the United States' most critical technologies from exploitation to maintain our battlefield pre-eminence. Our Need: Creative and innovative security engineers with prior systems, hardware, or software engineering experience with the drive to out think world class reverse engineers. BAE Systems is currently seeking creative, innovative problem solvers to be part of a system security engineering focused group. BAE Systems uses state-of-the-art technology, advanced mathematics, and physics in novel ways to protect our systems and provide our customers with capability that endures. Our engineers design solutions that achieve the optimum balance between product capability and defense-in-depth security. They apply all the lessons learned to our model-based design approach and frequently advance security state-of-the-art. They take their creative and innovative spirit to the extreme by playing the part of adversary through their identification of attack vectors. They propose countermeasures that provide the greatest protection at the best value for the system's entire lifecycle. Candidates should be capable of working in a team environment designing and implementing innovative protection schemes with rapidly evolving technologies used in various applications throughout the company. BAE Systems' salary and benefits include 401(k) matching, employee discount programs, and work schedule flexibility such as alternating Fridays off. The company culture emphasizes professional and personal growth through a Multicultural Network that supports cross-cultural initiatives and employee-sponsored groups promoting greater diversity, equity, and inclusion through networking, programs, and activities. Our System Security Engineers do a lot of amazing things, but for this role in particular you will: Design security architectures based on requirements from your analysis of adversary threats and proposed countermeasures Implement and test security countermeasures according to the guidance provided by the U.S. Government Work with Security State of the Art (S-SOTA) technologies Provide our customers with sophisticated, defense-in-depth security solutionsBecause of the need for consistent, in person collaboration and/or the requirement to perform all work onsite due to the nature of this particular role, it will be performed full time on site. This means work will be conducted on location at a BAE Systems facility 100% of the time. Required Education, Experience, & Skills Required skills: This role involves understanding systems engineering techniques and processes and requires a bachelor's degree plus eight or more years of work experience.Additional Critical Skills Include Writing System Requirements Defining System Architectures Integrating Hardware and Software Validating and Verifying the delivered solution Leading an Engineering Team Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills Preferred Skills: We are very interested in candidates with any of the following experience: Cryptographic algorithm implementation Configuring security features of Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) S-SOTA components Firmware development for COTS S-SOTA components such as Xilinx or Microsemi FPGAs Applying secure coding practices, securing operating systems, and virtualization Implementing and configuring security protocols Model-Based Systems Engineering using Cameo or MagicDraw Developing positive customer relationships Product design development and design analysis for manufacturability and maintainability Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $126610 - $215270 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it's what we do at BAE Systems. title: Systems Engineer Lead with Security Clearance
job_description: ResponsibilitiesJob Description Ready to make a difference? BAE Systems is looking Systems Engineering Leads to work as part of a cross-functional, multi-disciplinary team to design, integrate, debug, and test next generation EW systems. Focused on delivering innovative Electronic Warfare (EW) solutions, individual technical contributions on a related range of Programs will include system development, requirements development, integration & test, and test planning and execution in a field deployment environment. Responsibilities may include: Leading a medium or large team of Systems Engineers on EW related programs Managing all system engineering content and work products Understanding and implementing the product development process Schedule and cost account responsibilities for systems team Execution of systems planning and requirements development Creation and review of systems requirements to include, software, component, subsystem, and operational concepts Allocation of requirements to engineering disciplines Creating system test plans, procedures and reports Leading product design, development, integration, and verification Will have outside contact with customers, other contractors and government officials. Manage and participate in trade studies, peer reviews, and customer meetings Preparing and delivering technical presentations internally and with customers. Monitor and report metrics such as System Technical Performance Measures Supports proposal development activities, including proposal text development, cost and schedule estimating, and presentation activities.This position will require you to be onsite in either Nashua NH or Manchester NH. Because of the need for consistent, in-person collaboration and/or the requirement to perform all work onsite due to the nature of this particular role, it will be performed full-time on site. This means work will be conducted on location at a BAE Systems facility 100% of the time. See what you're missing. Electronic Combat Solutions has technology, engineering and program teams that educate and mentor colleagues to deliver leading Electronic Warfare capabilities. We welcome all those who have big ideas, crave innovation, want to drive fielding velocity and have the passion to bring the warfighter home safe. With a 9/80 schedule, and every other Friday off, our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first - exemplified by our mission: "We Protect Those Who Protect Us®." Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems. Required Education, Experience, & Skills * Bachelor's Degree of Science (or equivalent experience in a relevant field) with a minimum work experience of: 8+ Years with BS 6+ Years with MS 4+ Year with PHD Possess an Active US Government security clearance (with ability to possess TS) Leadership skills and experience directing and mentoring engineers on complex programs Expert in effectively documenting, communicating, leading and working with a team on designs, results, reports, and presentations. Experience performing systems engineering activities across the development cycle (analysis/decomposition/derivation/allocation of requirements, system modeling & simulation, system design & development, system integration & test) Experience developing viable concept solutions, identifying and tracking technical risks, and leading technical teams EVMS certification and previous CAM experience required. Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills * M.S. in Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering or a related engineering discipline and 11 years of experience or Ph.D. with 9 years of experience. Project/Program team member responsible for workflow, which is dynamic in nature. * Experience with EW and/or Radar and Missile Systems Experience with technical performance measurements and cost account management. Model based systems engineering experience with tools such as MagicDraw. Familiarity or experience with Agile Systems Engineering Active United States security clearance, Top Secret, SCI Eligible Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $122870 - $208890 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. title: System Security Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description Our Charter: Deter. Prevent. Detect. Respond. Our Mission: Safeguard the United States' most critical technologies from exploitation to maintain our battlefield pre-eminence. Our Need: Creative and innovative engineers with prior systems, hardware, or software engineering experience with interest in security and the drive to out think world class reverse engineers. In a modern approach to "Spy vs Spy," BAE Systems uses state-of-the-art technology, advanced mathematics, and physics in novel ways to protect our systems and provide our customers with capability that endures.Our system security engineers design solutions that achieve the optimum balance between product capability and defense-in-depth security. They apply all the lessons learned to our model-based design approach and frequently advance security state-of-the-art. They take their creative and innovative spirit to the extreme by playing the part of adversary through their identification of attack vectors. They propose countermeasures that provide the greatest protection at the best value for the system's entire lifecycle.BenefitsBAE Systems is currently seeking creative, innovative problem solvers who are able to analyze, assess, anticipate, defend, and react to current and future attacks. Candidates should be capable of working in a team environment designing and implementing innovative protection schemes with rapidly evolving technologies used in various applications throughout the company. BAE Systems' salary and benefits include 401(k) matching, employee discount programs, and work schedule flexibility such as alternating Fridays off. The company culture emphasizes professional and personal growth through a Multicultural Network that supports cross-cultural initiatives and employee-sponsored groups promoting greater diversity, equity, and inclusion through networking, programs, and activities. Our System Security Engineers do a lot of amazing things, but for this role in particular you will: Design security architectures based on requirements from your analysis of adversary threats and proposed countermeasures Implement and test security countermeasures according to the guidance provided by the U.S. Government Work with Security State of the Art (S-SOTA) technologies Provide our customers with sophisticated, defense-in-depth security solutionsBecause of the need for consistent, in person collaboration and/or the requirement to perform all work onsite due to the nature of this particular role, it will be performed full time on site.This means work will be conducted on location at a BAE Systems facility 100% of the time. Required Education, Experience, & Skills This role involves understanding systems engineering techniques and processes and requires a Bachelor's Degree in engineering, physics, mathematics, applied sciences, or a related field plus 4-6 years relevant work experience.Critical skills include: * Systems engineering knowledge Writing System Requirements Defining System Architectures Integrating Hardware and Software Validating and Verifying the delivered solution Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills Additional preferred skills include: Model-Based Systems Engineering using Cameo or MagicDraw Cryptographic algorithm implementation Configuring security features of Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) S-SOTA components Firmware development for COTS S-SOTA components such as Xilinx or Microsemi FPGAs Applying secure coding practices, securing operating systems, and virtualization Implementing and configuring security protocols Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $92290 - $156860 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. title: Senior Software Engineer
job_description: At Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet. That’s why we need smart, committed people to join us. Whether you’re looking to start your career or make a change, talk to us and see how you can elevate the power of your work at Iron Mountain.We provide expert, sustainable solutions in records and information management, digital transformation services, data centers, asset lifecycle management, and fine art storage, handling, and logistics. We proudly partner every day with our 225,000 customers around the world to preserve their invaluable artifacts, extract more from their inventory, and protect their data privacy in innovative and socially responsible ways.Are you curious about being part of our growth stor y while evolving your skills in a culture that will welcome your unique contributions? If so, let's start the conversation.Role: Senior Software EngineerJob Summary:At Iron Mountain, we protect what our customers value most, from the everyday to the extraordinary, while helping them bridge the physical and digital world. Today, we help our customers, including 95% of the Fortune 1000, to preserve priceless art, restore classic films, outsource their data centers around the globe and more. Our people have the opportunity to bring their creativity to a workplace that thrives on change. Here you will be part of a team that doesn't just embrace what's exceptional. It is exceptional. The Global Technology team at Iron Mountain deploys data center space to address growing customer needs and fast. Global Technology offers its customers a set of data center solutions that afforded greater convenience and accessibility.The Senior Software Engineer role will be a part of the Global Product Engineering team at Iron Mountain.The Senior Software Engineer position is in the Global Product Engineering organization assigned to the InSight project. Iron Mountain InSight is a content services platform that provides actionable business insights and predictive analytics through Machine Learning (ML)-based classification of a company’s physical and digital information, which adds structure, context and meta-data to information to make it more usable. The resulting enriched content can then enable enhanced automated governance and workflows for our customers.The Senior Software Engineer will provide design and delivery of service functionality within the agile development lifecycle. The ideal candidate will be an experienced engineer with micro service development for cloud-based services in highly performant systems. The candidate has over 7 years of experience developing service interfaces and APIs. To be successful, the candidate needs to show experience with Python core backend application development and SQL databases (SQL Server or Oracle or Postgresql or MySQL). The candidate must have experience exposing these backend systems over RESTful APIs, microservices, event driven architecture and framework which interact with cloud service providers. The candidate should have extensive development experience with python, docker and linux shell scripting.Responsibilities:Participate in design discussions about the technical implementation and consider the tradeoffs to support business value, scalability and delivery timeline. Develop service functionality using microservices APIs and JSON formatDefine service contract APIs for integrationAPI to API integrationsIntegrate Machine learning components in micro servicesWork with infrastructure teams to implement and build scalable systemsDevelop services for needs of UI developersDevelop unit tests with a test driven mindsetDebug and address performance issuesDesign and code for security considerations, anticipates security risksPeer / code reviewsLead the development of a product featureQualifications:Strong communication, collaboration and problem solving skills with a track record of delivering production grade systems in a team environmentExperience as a team lead working with 3-5 engineersMotivated individual who learns quickly, has pride in building a new product and can engage others to accelerate technical solutionsFamiliarity with implementation design patterns and performance challengesMinimum Bachelor’s degreeExperience in working with distributed teams3 years of experience working with agile scrum methodologies7-10 years of development experience in python, docker, shell scripting in linux, and SQL development3-5 years of experience with Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure in storage, compute and kubernetes servicesExperience in developing and deploying AIML scalable micro services and API gatewaysExperience with server oriented architectures and web platform applications with ability to define and integrate with APIs and REST servicesArchitectural governance and security review experienceExperience with agile tools such as Atlassian JIRA, Rally, TFS or Version OneMastery of code repositories such as GIT, artifactory repositoriesDesired ML skills:Machine Learning algorithms. Deep Learning and Neural Networks. Natural Language Processing. Domain Knowledge. Education:BS, MS or MBA from accredited/recognized university\Category: Information TechnologyIron Mountain is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit and hire applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, or any other factor prohibited by law.To view the Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law posters and the supplement, as well as the Pay Transparency Policy Statement, CLICK HERERequisition: J0071100

title: Principal Cloud Platform Engineer
job_description: About SequelSequel Med Tech is an early-stage company developing the next generation of precision drug delivery devices.Job OverviewOur innovative and growing company is looking for a Principal Cloud Platform Engineer. The Cloud Platform Engineer has end-to-end responsibility for designing and implementing Sequel’s cloud-based infrastructure to support our growing business needs. The initial focus of this role will be on standing up the basic cloud systems (AWS and/or Azure) to support our new application development team with an eye towards speed to market. From there, the candidate would be empowered to design and implement a best-in-class solution that integrates business processes and systems from across Sequel’s business and partnering with internal technical team and external consultants to implement this design. The ideal candidate for this role will have hands-on experience with AWS and Azure, have a deep understanding of best IT security practices, and be excited to build great digital platforms and products to support a rapidly growing medical device startup.Job Responsibilities And Essential DutiesLead the design, implementation, and maintenance of Sequel’s cloud-based infrastructure utilizing AWS and/or Azure services. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable and secure cloud solutions. Develop and implement best practices for cloud architecture, security, and operations to ensure the reliability, availability, and scalability of Sequel’s cloud platform. Work closely with the application development team to provide infrastructure support and guidance throughout the software development lifecycle. Implement infrastructure as code practices using tools such as Terraform to automate the provisioning and configuration of cloud resources. Monitor the performance and security of Sequel’s cloud infrastructure, utilizing a variety of monitoring tools and implementing necessary optimizations. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of Sequel’s cloud platform. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards related to cloud security and data privacy. Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior members of the cloud engineering team. Evaluate emerging cloud technologies and recommend solutions that align with Sequel’s business objectives and technical strategy. Participate in the resolution of complex technical issues related to Sequel’s cloud infrastructure, serving as a subject matter expert. Act as a liaison with external consultants and vendors to leverage their expertise in the design and implementation of Sequel’s cloud platform. Responsible for the technical implementation of the cloud environment and ongoing operations. Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field preferred 10+ years engineering experience at an enterprise level Required Knowledge, Skills, And AbilitiesExperience with AWS and Azure services for a variety of use cases, including data storage, hosting, identity and access management, cybersecurity, monitoring, and more. Experience with infrastructure as code, containers, CI/CD. Working with a breadth of monitoring tools to ensure performance and security. Ability to operate in a lean, agile environment, moving quickly to MVP and iterating to scale while ensuring cybersecurity and privacy remain paramount. Scaling enterprise service across geographies and understanding of data governance and replication. title: Lead Full-stack Software Engineer
job_description: About SequelSequel Med Tech is an early-stage company developing the next generation of precision drug delivery devices.Job OverviewSequel Med Tech, an emerging medical device company, is seeking a Lead Full-Stack Software Engineer to join our innovative and growing team. The Lead Full-Stack Software Engineer will be responsible for supporting front-end and back-end development for new digital products, partnering with the platform team to deploy cloud infrastructure, and providing a voice of the possible to business partners working to define new capabilities.The initial focus for this role will be on delivering our core digital experience for patients using our insulin delivery system. From there, the candidate would be working with the product leadership and patient experience team to envision and implement a roadmap of capabilities to improve patient access and ease of use of our technologies.Job Responsibilities And Essential DutiesDevelop and maintain high-quality, reusable, and scalable software solutions for Sequel Med Tech's digital products Collaborate with the product team to understand business requirements, translate them into technical requirements, and deliver solutions that meet both business and technical needs Work closely with other developers to ensure that software is designed and delivered according to best practices and standards Deploy and manage cloud infrastructure using AWS services Build integrations with external systems using APIs, authentication flows, and data transfer strategies Ensure that software is developed and maintained in compliance with regulatory requirements such as HIPAA, GxP, security requirements, GDPR, etc. Stay up-to-date with the latest technology trends and best practices, and make recommendations for improvements to software development processes and tools Collaborate with other team members to ensure that software is delivered on time, within budget, and meets quality standards Develop and maintain automated tests to ensure that software is of high quality and meets all requirements Work with the patient experience team to understand patient needs and develop user-friendly interfaces for digital products Ensure that software is secure and data is properly managed - Develop and maintain DevOps pipelines to streamline the software development process Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field preferred5+ years of experience in software development, with a focus on full-stack development Required Knowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesExperience with node.js and react.js Familiarity with test automation approaches and tools Experience with common development tools like GitHub, Jira, etc. Ability to work collaboratively and across disciplines with other developers to design and deliver software to solve patient, clinical, and business needs Experience working within a regulated industry – healthcare experience a plus Strong understanding of security requirements, data management, and DevOps pipelines Excellent problem-solving, communication, and teamwork skills Passion for building great patient-, caregiver-, and clinician-facing products to support a rapidly growing medical devices startupSequel Med Tech provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.Powered by JazzHR79paU1lVrN

title: Software Engineer III - Cloud CAO (Remote, East Coast)
job_description: #WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We work on large scale distributed systems, processing over 1 trillion events a day with a petabyte of RAM deployed in our Cassandra clusters - and this traffic is growing daily. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to developing and shaping our cybersecurity platform. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.The Counter Adversary Operations (CAO) Team is a newly formed, first-of-its kind team that brings together CrowdStrike Falcon® Intelligence and the CrowdStrike® Falcon OverWatch™ threat hunting team to disrupt today’s adversaries and ultimately raise their cost of doing business. Both threat hunting and intelligence operations are essential to detect, disrupt and stop today’s adversaries. CrowdStrike Counter Adversary Operations will have the power of both — along with the trillions of telemetry events from the AI-powered CrowdStrike Falcon® platform — to quickly act and intensify its impact on adversary activity. CrowdStrike’s deep adversary knowledge, expertise in pursuing and stopping threats, and visibility derived from the Falcon platform make us uniquely qualified to deliver the most effective method of stopping breaches and protecting customers.You can also take a closer look at some of the CAO projects here.About The RoleCrowdStrike is looking for a Cloud Software Engineer to join our growing CAO Engineering Team. Our new colleague will be responsible for building globally distributed, fault-tolerant, and highly scalable cloud ecosystems using Golang. Prior experience with Golang is not required, but will be helpful.CrowdStrike is a computer security company, but we do not require candidates for this role to have prior security industry experience. We will mentor and train in security topics as needed. We do expect a strong interest in CrowdStrike's mission and a willingness to engage with the needs of our product teams and customers.This position requiresWhat You'll DoWork on and enrich backend microservices – From researching areas of concern to implementing the final solution Leverage existing Crowdstrike tool and services to build cloud-based systems to help detect targeted attacksBrainstorm, research, define, communicate, and build collaboratively with members across multiple teamsBe committed to learning and improving.Be aware of our customers and the difficulties they face and how we can support.Have a strong focus on Quality of Coding through Best Practices, Testing, Logging and Metrics.Work in a Collaborating & Agile environment with a small fast-moving teamBe given the autonomy to own your work in a high trust environmentTech StackIn-depth knowledge of all is not required, but the ability to ramp-up and learn is.Go (Golang)DockerKubernetesAWSRedis / S3 / EC2 / IAMKafkaGITCassandraElasticSearchWhat You'll NeedDegree in Computer Science (or professional experience in data structures/algorithms/distributed systems)At least 3 years of previous experience as a Software Engineer.Solid understanding of scalability and distributed systems core concepts i.e. sharding, partitioning, concurrency, etcBeing a team player A good grasp of engineering best practices from appropriate testing paradigms to effective peer code reviews and resilient architecture.The ability to thrive in a test-driven, collaborative, and iterative programming environment.The skills to meet your commitments on time and produce high-quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed and checked in regularly for continuous integration.Bonus PointsExisting exposure to Go, AWS, Cassandra, Kafka, ElasticsearchPrior experience in the cybersecurity or intelligence fields#HTFBenefits Of Working At CrowdStrikeRemote-first cultureMarket leader in compensation and equity awardsCompetitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefitsPhysical and mental wellness programsPaid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunitiesOffices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaborationWe are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com for further assistance.CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.Notice of E-Verify ParticipationRight to WorkCrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary range for this position in the U.S. is $115,000 - $175,000 per year + variable/incentive compensation + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location.
