title: C++ DEVELOPER -  TRADING, FIX PROTOCOL
job_description: Job Title : C++ DeveloperVisa : NO OPT, CPT or H1 TransfersPhone interview then Video ZoomRequirementsMUST HAVES C++ , TRADING, FIX PROTOCOL, AND GOLANGSenior level 8+ yrs.The Expertise We're Looking ForExperience deploying and supporting a production Electronic Trading System in a Linux environmentExpert or Power User Knowledge of the Linux Operating SystemExpert knowledge and experience with the FIX protocol5+ years with operations and handling production support issues preferably with high frequency trading systemsExperience with task automation using off-the-shelf tools and/or customized scripts (Perl, Python, Bash, etc.)Working knowledge of basic network tools (ssh, ping, netstat, tcpdump, traceroute, etc.)Experience managing and supporting virtual infrastructure such as VMWareExperience developing procedures and creating operations documentationExperience troubleshooting problems and deploying fixes and upgrades to productionKnowledge of and/or working experience with Alerting tools and dashboards such as ServiceNow and JMagic

title: Lead Software Engineer (3613)
job_description: ***This role is hybrid and will require some office attendance at our Manchester, NH hub. Please only apply if you are able to attend this location regularly***About GBG:GBG is the leading expert in global digital identity. We combine our powerful technology, the most accurate data coverage and our talented team to deliver award-winning location intelligence, identity verification and fraud prevention solutions.With over 30 years’ experience, we bring together a team of over 1,100 dedicated experts with local industry insight from around the world to make it easy for businesses to identify and verify customers and locations, protecting everyone, everywhere from fraud.Why you should be@GBG We make the world a safer placeWe trust each other and win togetherWe are local experts in a global businessWe want you to be yourselfWe grow when you growThe Team:We build and own the delivery of AssureID Sentinel and AcuFill desktop applications, which are part of GBG’s Documents and Biometrics product portfolio. We are a cross functional team who pride ourselves on our collaborative spirit. We value every team member’s expertise, and each member contributes to our collective success. Our daily work follows Agile methodology, placing a strong emphasis on automation.The Role:You will play a multifaceted role within the team, serving as both a hands-on contributor and a mentor to less experienced members. Your software engineering expertise is instrumental in driving the team towards achieving sprint goals and delivering on project milestone.Beyond your individual contributions, you take on the responsibility of cultivating a culture of technical excellence within the team. This entails guiding and mentoring team members, sharing your knowledge and expertise to ensure that projects are completed successfully.A crucial aspect of your role is the establishment of a knowledge-sharing culture, where you actively capture, document, and disseminate technical knowledge, including best practices, coding standards, and architectural decisions. By facilitating knowledge-sharing sessions, conducting thorough code reviews, and fostering open technical discussions, you empower team members to learn from each other's experiences and uphold consistency in development practices.Although you do not have direct people management responsibilities, your influence within the team is significant. You lead cross-disciplinary initiatives and play a key role in shaping decision-making processes, leveraging your extensive technical expertise to drive impactful outcomes.One of your most valuable attributes is your ability to quickly grasp complex systems and identify opportunities for improvement. With a pragmatic approach to problem-solving, you demonstrate persistence, determination, and creativity in overcoming technical challenges. This mindset allows you to navigate through obstacles effectively, finding innovative yet practical solutions that balance technical excellence with real-world constraints.Ultimately, your contributions enable new team members to integrate seamlessly and make meaningful contributions to project outcomes right from the outsetWhat you will do:Serving as a hands-on contributor: Actively participating in engineering tasks to drive the team towards achieving sprint goals and deliverables.Driving Technical Excellence: Upholding and advancing technical standards within the team by ensuring coding practices, software design, and implementation adhere to best practices and industry standards.Conducting Technical Reviews: Regularly reviewing code, architecture, and system designs to ensure adherence to standards, identify areas for improvement, and mitigate technical debt.Understanding Existing Solution Implementations: Possessing a thorough understanding of existing solution implementations within the team to make informed decisions and contributions to ongoing initiatives.Mentoring Less Experienced Members: Mentoring team members by providing technical guidance, support, and feedback to help them grow their skills and capabilities.Providing Technical Leadership: Serving as a technical leader within the team, contributing to technical strategy, decision-making, and roadmap planning.Promoting Innovation: Encouraging a culture of innovation within the team by exploring new technologies, tools, and methodologies that can enhance product quality and development efficiency.Ensuring Project Success: Leveraging technical expertise to contribute to planning, execution, and delivery, overcoming technical challenges to achieve goals.Leading Cross-Disciplinary Initiatives: Leading and contributing to cross-disciplinary initiatives that require technical expertise from multiple areas, collaborating with other teams or departments to tackle complex technical problems and drive innovation.Collaborating with Stakeholders: Engaging with stakeholders to understand business requirements, provide technical insights, and align technical solutions with business objectives.Resolving Technical Issues: Acting as a point of escalation for resolving complex technical issues and troubleshooting system failures, ensuring timely resolution and minimal disruption to project timelines.Driving Continuous Improvement: Continuously identifying opportunities for process optimization, automation, and efficiency enhancements within the development workflow.What we're looking for:Technical Proficiency: A robust background in software engineering coupled with mastery of relevant technologies, programming languages, and engineering best practices. A demonstrated ability to offer technical guidance, conduct code reviews, and make informed decisions regarding architectural designs and software development processes.Mentorship and Coaching: A passion for mentorship and a desire to help others grow and develop their skills. You provide constructive feedback, offer guidance and support, and create opportunities for learning and development within the team.Problem-Solving Skills: Proficiency in identifying and resolving intricate technical issues using a logical and analytical approach. You are resourceful, creative, and adaptable, with a willingness to tackle complex technical challenges.Communication Skills: Excellent ability to communicate clearly and succinctly with team members, stakeholders, and senior management.Adaptability and Resilience: The capacity to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, adapt to changing priorities and requirements, and overcome obstacles with resilience and determination. You are flexible and able to prioritize effectively to meet project deadlines and objectives.Strategic Thinking: The ability to think strategically and align technical solutions with business objectives. You ensure you have a holistic view of the project landscape, understand the implications of technical decisions, and contribute to the overall strategic direction of the team.Continuous Learning Mindset: A commitment to continuous learning and professional development, with a curiosity for exploring new technologies, tools, and methodologies. You stay updated with industry trends and advancements to drive innovation and maintain technical relevance.Collaboration and Communication: Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and external partners. You communicate technical concepts clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences.Attention to Detail: A meticulous approach to work, with a focus on maintaining high standards of quality and precision in coding, documentation, and technical reviews.Next stepsClick apply to see more about what’s important to us, including our flexible working policy, our commitment to ESG, I&D and much more.To chat to the Talent Attraction team and find out more about our benefits, drop an email to behired@gbgplc.com and we’ll be in touch!Make life@GBG work for you.

title: Principal, Site Reliability Engineer
job_description: 2092435Job DescriptionOur Site Reliability Engineering group within Enterprise Infrastructure combines Operations Excellence with the Development Experience to deliver services at high scale, high availability with resilience by using automation and Infrastructure Code. We build reliability into our ecosystem by applying standard processes in Resiliency Engineering, Automation, Observability & Chaos Testing.The team comes from diverse technical backgrounds, and the responsibilities provide the opportunity for a variety of challenges. Ideal candidates will have a background in either software engineering or systems engineering with a desire to learn the other or previous experience as an SRE. We are looking for a Systems Thinking, SRE Engineer who has helped teams scale through production insights, operational automation, developer guidance, real-time metrics, automation, automation, automation!The Expertise You Have And The Skills You BringBachelor’s degree or higher in a technology related field (e.g., Engineering, Computer Science, etc.) required, Master’s degree a plus4+ years of hands-on experience deploying and/or supporting highly distributed multi-tiered systems at scale.1-2 years of experience in Cloud development (AWS) and migration skills; Experience with building and operating highly resilient platforms in AWS cloud environments1-2 years of experience in software development with Python, NodeJS, or Java with a focus on SDLC and automationHands-on experience with container orchestration, preferably with KubernetesExperience operating and implementing distributed & highly concurrent service-basedAbility to automate with various scripting languages (Python, Shell scripting, etc.)Experience managing systems using infrastructure as code tools (IAM, ARM, Terraform, Chef)Solid understanding of Cloud Computing and DevOps concepts including CI/CD pipelinesHands-on Kubernetes skills and knowledge.Hands on experience with one or more observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK/OpenSearch, OpenTelemetry, Datadog, etc.)Experienced in Instrumentation with systems skills on building and operating, monitoring, logging, alerting services of distributed systems at scaleProven experience in maintaining scalability and resiliency of complex environment.Proven experience in implementing advanced observability practices and techniques at scale.Demonstrated ability to apply modern monitoring tools (DataDog, Prometheus, Splunk)Experienced in Instrumentation with systems skills on building and operating, monitoring, logging, alerting services of distributed systems at scaleAbility to triage, implement root cause analysis, and be decisive under pressureExperience managing and interpreting large datasets using query languages and visualization toolsProficient communication skills with an ability to reach both technical and non-technical audienceAbility to learn new software, method and practices and bringing them to our developersAbility to work with a variety of individuals and groups, both in person and virtually, in a constructive and collaborative manner and build and maintain effective relationshipsCertificationsCompany OverviewFidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: CNC Programmer (Onsite)
company: Global Technical Talent, an Inc. 5000 Company
job_description: Direct Hire Job Duties & Responsibilities:The CNC Programmer will develop CNC programs using MasterCam, GibbsCAM, or Partmaker.Configure tools and ensure efficient production.CNC Programmer will analyze blueprints in order to calculate the correct part dimension for tool selection, machine speeds, and feed rates.Occasionally set up and operate CNC equipment.CNC Programmer make mechanical and/or program adjustments to ensure parts are meeting quantity and quality requirements.Communicate recommendations to engineering to modify parts and processesCarry out other duties reasonably within capability as required by the supervisor.Education and/or Experience:High School or GED Diploma required - Associate's Degree or Certification in a related field preferred.3-5 years of experience with CNC programming, and operating a CNC machine.Experience programming in MasterCam, GibbsCAM, or Partmaker.Use precision measuring instruments including micrometers and calipers, and fixtures and gauges to check work.Read Instrumentation and gauges to accurately measure dimensions on parts that are being machined.Must have a proficient understanding of G-code and M-code programming.Experience setting up and troubleshooting CNC machines.Able to demonstrate good manufacturing practices and be able to select tooling and machining resources for the manufacture of parts.Strong mathematical skills.Blueprint with GD&T reading capabilities.Able to work under own initiative.Flexible, courteous, friendly, and positive approach.Discretion, confidentiality, and professionalism at all times.Ability to follow written and verbal instructions.Ability to work in a team environment.Make a positive contribution to maintaining a workplace that is safe, neat, and tidyWorking Conditions:Able to lift up to 40 poundsMust wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) which is required in designated areas.Note:New Hampshire Locations (Openings in Newington, Exeter & Rochester, NH) All shiftsBenefits:Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance Plans401k Retirement FundAbout the Company:Our client is a leading provider and manufacturer of firearms, electro-optics, ammunition, airguns, suppressors, remote controlled weapons stations, and training. Today, they are synonymous with industry-leading quality and innovation which has made it the brand of choice amongst the U.S. Military, the global defense community, law enforcement, competitive shooters, hunters, and responsible citizens. Their tremendous growth fuels outstanding opportunities for experienced professionals to join their team. As part of the client family, you’ll enjoy generous benefits and opportunities to explore new roles within the organization.#gttnonit

title: Principal Software Engineer
job_description: 2092886-1Job DescriptionPrincipal Software Engineer in Test (Level 6)Location: Westlake, TXAdditional Locations: Raleigh, NCMerrimack, NHThe TeamThe Fidelity Health Benefits Group supports the recordkeeping and administration of health benefits (medical, dental and vision plans) and life insurance plans on behalf of Fidelity’s corporate clients, their employees and retirees. title: Principal Test Software Engineer/TPS Developer
job_description: Job Description See what you’re missing. Our employees work on the world’s most advanced electronics – from detecting threats for F-35 pilots to illuminating the night for soldiers. Spanning air, land, sea, and space, we are developing the technology of tomorrow, delivered today. Drawing strength from our differences, we’re innovating for the future. And you can, too. Our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first – exemplified by our mission: “We Protect Those Who Protect Us®.” Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems.BAE Systems is looking for an experienced Test Engineer for our Integrated Test Engineering (ITE). The ITE organization’s mission is to reliably deliver customer-focused, affordable test solutions which are integrated across all levels of production test. Experience the entire life cycle of a program to include bid and proposal, advanced development and demonstration, test design and development, product fielding, procurement, and sustainment.Are you an experienced Electrical, Software or Test Design Engineer with 8+ years of experience looking for the next step to grow your career? Do you want to design and develop test solutions and/or write test software that is mission critical and be a part of a greater cause? Then, help us protect those that protect us by developing the Next Generation Electronic Warfare Systems Products and Solutions. We need your talent, motivation, and vision to join our New Hampshire based team. BAE Systems has recently been awarded new programs and is currently undergoing an exciting period of growth. We have multiple positions in Southern New Hampshire (our locations include Nashua, Hudson, Merrimack, and Manchester).The selected candidate will be part of a test engineering team throughout the product lifecycle and you will motivate and inspire the engineering team across geographical boundaries to achieve more than they believe is possible! When you become a member of our team, you will work across multiple disciplines and collaborate with Systems, Hardware, Operations, Production, and Test Engineers to impact all phases of the Product Development and sustainment Lifecycle. At BAE Systems, we promote a strong, collaborative culture and provide our employees with the tools, skills and training they need to succeed. We are all about trust, camaraderie, and a shared ambition to lead the world in defense technologies and national security services. We offer a flexible work environment and 9/80 work schedule. Our company is part of the community and driven to improve our future and protect our freedom.The ideal candidate must be a motivated self-starter, able to complete assignments with little oversight while being available as a subject matter expert and technical lead to their team. They must be able to assume a full or partial lead role as circumstances dictate and be able to quickly and dynamically switch focus to accommodate the daily activities of an engineering team supporting a production environment. This individual should be comfortable providing accurate technical status to program management or direction to individual contributors as part of their job function, as well as interfacing with other engineering disciplines as necessary. The Test Engineer should have a strong background in Software, Electrical or Computer Engineering, and possess a demonstrated ability in designing, developing, debugging, integrating, and deploying complex automated test systems, test applications, documentation, and Commercial Instrumentation for testing Military Comms, Navigation, and Electronic Warfare equipment.Because this role involves a combination of collaborative/in-person and independent work, it will take the form of a hybrid work format, with time split between working onsite and remotely.Required Education, Experience, & Skills An Active US Secret Clearance is required for this position. Experienced in architecting, designing, analyzing/deriving requirements, coding and code modification, integration, and sell-off of test software for analog, digital, RF, and hybrid modules at board level, system level, and subsystems level using commercial and custom test measurement equipment.Experience in C/C#, National Instrument (NI) Test Stand, Python, and CVI software development environments.Experience in evaluating and debugging test solution to identify product design flaws.Experience in developing instrument drivers, utilities, test executives, and test software used to support testing and verification activities for system development, production, and sustainment testing activities.Experience in developing documentation for test requirements, test design, test plan, and operating procedures for acceptance test and environmental stress screening applications.Experienced in using test instrumentation such as Network Analyzer, Spectrum Analyzer, Signal Generators, Microwave/RF measurements etc.Familiar with basic RF testing concepts such as VSWR, Gain, Compression, Phase Noise etc.Experience in HW debugging (test adapters, cables, tools, and interface modules)Motivated, self-starter, good communication skills, team player, and “can-do” attitude.Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills Experience in factory production test stands, problem isolation and resolution.Experienced in developing RF test measurements for production.Familiar with boundary scan tools and softwareFamiliar with FPGA programming and debugging. Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $112420 - $191070Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And InclusionAt BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And InclusionAt BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

title: Senior Salesforce Developer
job_description: The Opportunity:The Senior Salesforce Developer will play a critical role in helping drive the digital transformation initiative across Medicus that will enable growth, efficiency and manage risk. Play a leading role in the applications development, architecture and systems integration team to deliver enhanced technology solutions to Medicus. This role will be responsible for collaborating with technical in-house resources, external consultants and third party vendors and partnering with key business functions to develop, implement and optimize core business systems. The role will also include hands on design, development, integration and support.This position is located at our office in Windham, New Hampshire, with a minimum requirement of 3 days/week in-office.In this role, you will:Partner with colleagues across IT, Business Development, Recruiting, Marketing, Operations, Finance and others to leverage technology to drive improvements in operational efficiency, profitability and customer experience;Drive the delivery and management of key development, database and integration initiatives to maximize the investment in technology;Application design and configuration using Salesforce.com automation (SFA);Further advance Medicus digital platforms to enhance the customer experience in the form of development enhancements to our customer web portals and mobile application(s);Lead, manage and actively participate in the development, configuration and deployment of applications and API’s to new and existing applications and third party systems; andParticipate and evaluate in the research and understanding of emerging technologies and how they can enhance Medicus’ business.Requirements:Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret end user business needs and translate them into application and operational solutions;Results oriented, with high energy focus on achieving both short and long term goals;Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment;5+ years of progressive experience in applications development;3+ years of Salesforce development experience including Apex, Visualforce, Flows, Triggers, etc.Understanding of Salesforce Design and Development Best Practices, Apex Design Parameters, Governor Limits, Shared Platform Best PracticesSalesforce Certifications3+ years of experience driving solutions leveraging technologies including: C#, JavaScript and .NET development; SQL/SQL Server and relational database design and implementation; web-based applications; Backend REST API development; HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Angular;Strong experience with SDLC and quality assurance testing best practices;Ability to initiate and maintain cooperative relationships with co-workers, managers, supervisors, and customers/clients; andExcellent interpersonal and communication skills.Why You Should Work with Us:Quarterly company bonus incentivesClearly defined benchmarks for career progressionUnlimited Paid Time OffFull medical, dental, and vision benefits--starting DAY 1!401(k) matching program, fully vestedComprehensive new-hire training and ongoing learning opportunitiesQuarterly company meetings and social eventsState-of-the-art fitness facility and fitness classes offered each weekVolunteer Time OffOpportunity to go on President's Club (all-expense paid trip for two!)Your character is more important than any level of skill, experience, or education. We expect all of our people to exhibit these common attributes: high level of integrity, desire for excellence, strong work ethic, results-oriented team player.Medicus is proud to share our commitment to diversity and are excited to continue advancing and promoting DEI in the workplace.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Voted Forbes list of America’s Best In-State Credit Unions 6 years in a row!  At Northeast, our core values drive our mission and vision. Our mission is to enrich and nourish the lives of others: Our members, our employees, and our communities.Experience Driven-People Focused: Collaborate with team members to provide the best experience possible for our members.Be a Force for Good: Support volunteerism and community engagement inside and outside of the organization. Empower Excellence: Communicate openly and care for the well-being of yourself and your team. Build results through positive relationships that support diversity and inclusion. Lead From Your Seat: Challenge the status quo! Be your true self and take initiative, while supporting and recognizing those around you.Role:The Business Intelligence Analyst partners with business partners across the credit union to understand their business needs and translates those needs into actionable analytics solutions. They lead business intelligence efforts and develop visualization and analytics solutions. In addition, the Business Intelligence Analyst facilitates the adoption of Agile methodologies, creates and oversees documentation and artifact design and delivery, and serves as a communication champion for the Data & Analytics team.This role will also adhere to and uphold Northeast Credit Union's Values and Service Standards. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Professional office work environment. We support a remote or hybrid work environment.25% Partners with business partners to understand their business needs and translate these into actionable analytics solutions. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to drive analytics projects, ensuring alignment with institution’s strategic goals and client objectives. Acts as a liaison between technical teams and non-technical stakeholders, effectively communicating complex data concepts in an accessible manner. 25%Develops and maintains advanced dashboards and reports to provide insightful data visualizations and business intelligence solutions. Provides mentorship and guidance to team members on best practices in data visualization.25%Leads data analytics projects utilizing institutional business intelligence tools and approaches for visualizing and interpreting data. Manages project lifecycle, including planning, execution, monitoring, and completion, ensuring deliverables meet client expectations in terms of quality and timeliness. Facilitates the adoption of Agile methodologies within the team to enhance project delivery and team performance.15%Leads creation and management of documentation and internal/business partner facing deliverables and artifacts. Oversees and maintains team’s communication efforts and champions services and accomplishments through effective outreach and information sharing.10%Performs other job-related duties as assignedKnowledge and Skills:Proven experience providing data analytics solutions with 5+ years of experience in a senior data visualization development and project lead role.Advanced proficiency in Tableau leveraging features that drive optimization.Standard Tableau knowledge including dashboard creation, data modeling, and visual analytics. Demonstrated ability to lead and manage data analytics projects, with a track record of successful delivery.Solid understanding of data analytics principles, data structures, and business intelligence trends.Exceptional problem-solving, analytical, and decision-making skills.Strong communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex data insights to diverse audiences.Advanced ability to draw insights from data and communicate findings to stakeholders and business leaders.Proven ability to work cross functionally and provide leadership to understand and drive business insight and create strategic alignment of data and analytics solutions.Demonstrated success in leading projects and creating impactful relationships and outcomes with business partners.Familiarity and experience with Jira and Confluence desired.Familiarity and experience with other BI tools such as Power BI, Snowflake, SQL, and data warehousing concepts is advantageous.Financial institution and member/customer research experience desired. Experience with financial transaction systems preferredEducation:Bachelor’s Degree; or equivalent experience and training._______________________________________________Benefits We Offer:  Employee loan discountStudent loan/tuition assistance programComprehensive medical/dental/vision +PTO and paid federal holidays Weekly paychecks401k plan with employer match/profit sharingParticipation in the Annual Incentive Plan Additional Perks:Continued training and advancement opportunities Balanced/Predictable schedule; all locations close at 5pm and on Sundays Opportunity to join our many employee created Engagement Groups (e.g. Pride at Work, Women in Leadership, Book Club, Running & Walking)Local Volunteer Opportunities with employer contributed Volunteer DayCompany Outings and annual Summit Hybrid work environments  ______________________________________________________________ Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Principal Quant Developer
job_description: 2088586-1Job DescriptionPrincipal Quant DeveloperIn your role as Quant Solutions Specialist (Principal Quant Developer), you will work closely with quant researchers to understand their technology needs and deliver solutions for them, either through enterprising code written by research analyst or build solutions directly yourself. You will be responsible for a library of quant research tools shared by researchers across all asset classes. Your work will span software engineering and quant research, using your knowledge of both good engineering practice, architecture, and agile development, along with domain expertise in research processes and quant datasets.The Expertise And Skills You BringA Bachelor’s degree, or higher, in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or finance.5+ years of software development and/or data engineering experience in quantitative finance.Experience working in quant research environments, and with tools and datasets, at a best-in-class quant research group.Proven track record working in agile environments to deliver high-quality solutions on time.Significant experience with software engineering best practices and a track record delivering production-quality code.Expertise with tools and technologies used in the quant research process including Python (Pandas and NumPy), R, and FactSetExperience implementing quant models, factors, or tools in both research and production pipelinesExpertise in the software development lifecycle using agile techniquesFamiliarity with the quant research process and exposure to quant research across multiple asset classesHighly proactive and self-motivated with the ability to meet objectives under minimal direction.Experience with Cloud-native platforms (AWS, Snowflake, etc.)The Value You BringUse your skills and experience to develop a common library of utilities quant researchers can use across varied use cases, research workflows, and asset classesRefactor various quant research needs into reusable solutions and shape researcher requirements to better use common frameworks.Support researchers in using the technologies you develop, providing documentation, education, and technology evangelism across various research groupsDevelop production-quality code with outstanding code coverage and regression testing across a suite of libraries. Handle aspects of the release process, dependency conflicts, and other production-related aspects to make the offering enterprise-gradeAdvocating for researchers’ needs in design efforts covering backend systems like data management and code sharingDevelop a roadmap, achieve your timelines, and provide guidance to executives on progress and key opportunitiesThe TeamAsset Management Technology (AMT) provides worldwide technology and support to all the Investment Management, Research, Trading, and Investment Operations functions. We are seeking a Principal quant developer to join our Quantitative Research & Investing Technology organization. This role will be part of our Quantitative Engineering team, which is responsible for architecting, developing, and maintaining a new quant research oriented meta-data programming language.The base salary range for this position is $85,000-$179,000 per year.Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidate’s relevant experience, and other factors.Base salary is only part of the total compensation package. Depending on the position and eligibility requirements, the offer package may also include bonus or other variable compensation.We offer a wide range of benefits to meet your evolving needs and help you live your best life at work and at home. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage and emotional well-being support, market-leading retirement, generous paid time off and parental leave, charitable giving employee match program, and educational assistance including student loan repayment, tuition reimbursement, and learning resources to develop your career. title: Software Engineering Tools DevOps Administrator - (cloud environments - TS/SC clearance)
job_description: Job Description BAE Systems has a job opening for a Software Engineering Tools DevOps administrator. As a key member of the Software Engineering Tools team, the DevOps administrator will work closely with the Platform Engineering (PE) group that manages an on-premises Virtual Cloud Computing Center (VC3). The Software Engineering Tools team seeks a motivated DevOps Technical Support Administrator to tackle the task of automating reliable, sustainable, and optimized services for bringing modernized, cloud native compute technologies into closed area environments ranging from large, multi-site networks to small air-gapped environments. Your efforts on our cloud-based systems ensures application security, scalability, and reliability across multiple security enclaves to support the Software Engineering Digital Ecosystem. Your experience and passion for DevOps practices and tools will be essential in automating processes, streamlining deployments, providing disaster recovery and improving the overall efficiency of our services.Key ResponsibilitiesAct as the focal point for bringing modernized, cloud native compute technologies into BAE closed area environments.Collaborate with the Platform Engineering and Closed Room Operations/Infrastructure teams to define infrastructure requirements, understand application needs, optimize system performance, scalability, and reliability.Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for seamless application deployment and continuous integration using industry-standard tools and frameworks.Work in closed area environments to deploy tools and train administrators on support and operations activities.Automate infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and monitoring using tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or similar technologies.Monitor system performance, conduct root cause analysis, and implement optimizations to enhance system availability, reliability, and efficiency.Troubleshoot and resolve production incidents related to performance, availability, infrastructure, networking, and application deployment in a timely manner.Provide close coordination with security -- ISSE’s, ISSM’s, ISSO’s -- ensuring compliance and auditability.Participate in service improvement initiatives, including identifying opportunities for service optimization and cost reduction.Stay up to date with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in DevOps to continuously improve the infrastructure and development processes.Work with Engineering to refine requirements into an IT plan related to modernization and DevOps needs to include modernized workloads, cloud native computing, on premise cloud, containerization, etc.Create and maintain documentation for engineering application installations and upgrades.Assist with incident response and problem management to minimize service downtime and ensure swift recovery from interruptions.Support users in a timely manner using ServiceNow Help Desk ticketing system.Ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements. The Software Engineering Tools DevOps Administrator will be expected to demonstrate a high level of technical expertise, strong troubleshooting skills, attention to detail, solid leadership skills, a customer-focused attitude, a passion to learn, self-motivated and work well in teams. Flexibility in approach to finding solutions, the ability to understand and act on the customer needs and priorities and learn new technologies quickly are some of the qualities a successful candidate will have. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of delivering high-quality services in a cloud-based ecosystem and will be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You will need to be comfortable working with various stakeholders, including tenants, developers, and managers, and will have strong communication and collaboration skills. The DevOps Administrator will have an understanding of cloud infrastructure and the ability to bridge between development and operations. The Software Engineering Tools team believes in investing in our professionals. Training time and opportunities are available to increase skills and keep knowledge cutting edge.Required Education, Experience, & Skills Required SkillsAbility to obtain a Secret clearance and CompTIA Security+ or equivalent certification within 6 months of hireProven experience as a DevOps Engineer or a similar roleKnowledge of on-premises cloud infrastructure technologies, such as OpenStack, VMware, or Azure StackProficiency in scripting and automation using languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShellStrong understanding of cloud services including virtualization, containerization, and related architectural principlesFamiliarity with automation toolkits such as Ansible, Terraform, or PackerHands-on experience with CI/CD tools like GitLab and understand version control and git workflowsUnderstanding of networking concepts, TCP/IP, DNS, load balancing, and firewall configurationKnowledge of Linux/Unix systems administration and troubleshootingFamiliarity with monitoring tools and frameworks (e.g., Nagios, Prometheus, ELK stack)Working experience with Kubernetes and other containerization technologiesOccasional off-hour response to outages and subsequent service restoration effortsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholdersStrong understanding of security and regulatory compliance requirementsDemonstrated problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work effectively in a teamExhibit sound judgement, initiative and self-motivation and able to complete tasks with minimal supervisionClose collaboration with peers, Platform Engineering, Engineering, various stakeholders and managers is essentialPreferred Education, Experience, & Skills Preferred A Security+ or equivalent certificationExperience deploying SaaS and PaaS services for use by other usersHaving a TS/SC clearanceExperience working in a customer service organization to resolve issues experienced by usersKubernetes certifications such as CKAD, CKA, or CKSConducting zero downtime Kubernetes upgradesGeneral understanding of Engineering disciplines and toolsTypical Education And ExperienceBachelor's Degree Minimum of 5 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role with on-premise cloud environmentsPay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $112420 - $191070Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.About BAE Systems, Inc.BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And InclusionAt BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

job_description: NET Developer, .NET 8, C# – Global Internet Icon – Portsmouth(Tech stack: .NET Developer, .NET 8, C#, Blazor, Azure, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Agile, Programmer, Full Stack Engineer, Architect, .NET Developer)Our client has long been a classic internet icon; today it has evolved into an integrated and diversified modern media company. title: Senior Systems Engineer
job_description: 2083661-1Job DescriptionWe are looking for a highly motivated individual to join our Production Services/SRE Team supporting the Asset Management Technology - Cloud Platform solutions. You will provide level 2 application support and work closely with multiple BU. The position requires a deep understanding of application and infrastructure support and familiarity with supporting cloud computing environments. We build reliability into our ecosystem by applying best practices in Resiliency Engineering, Automation, Observability & Chaos Testing.The Expertise You Have And The Skills You Bring4+ years of experience in systems and platform operations and technology managementExpertise with Agile (Scrum, Kanban) delivery and system design, development, test and operational automationSolid understanding of On Prem and Public Cloud as well as hands on experience working with public cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP)Experience supporting 24/7, continuous availability production and managed environments.Deep understanding of software architecture to help empower software developers and engineers to build platforms with greater resiliency and fault tolerance in mind.SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) principles a plus – resiliency, observability and governance gatingSoftware development skills (at least one) – proficiency in the C#, ASP .net stack and Java development. title: Systems Engineer - C4ISR Integration and Test
job_description: Job Description Ready to make a difference? Our employees design, integrate, and test the world’s next generation communication and electronic warfare systems for the United States DoD and international customers. You will be among the brightest minds, working on the aerospace and defense industry’s most difficult problems. Drawing strength from our differences, we’re innovating for the future. We put our customers first – exemplified by our mission: “We Protect Those Who Protect Us®.” Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with us.C4ISR, a high growth, entrepreneurial organization, that develops state-of the-art mission management technologies, components and systems for many customers in the defense industry. Today’s warfighters and intelligence analysts are overwhelmed with data and tasks from a variety of unmanned vehicle systems. C4ISR helps the warfighter become more effective in supplying Software Defined Open Architecture SIGINT systems.Responsibilities Of This Software/hardware Oriented Role IncludePerform Integration and Test of Software into hardware systemsHands-on Integration and Test of SIGINT systemsDevelopment of test toolsInterface with Systems Engineering and Software Development TeamsProblem/anomaly reporting, tracking and resolutionAgile development environmentGeneration of Test Plans, detailed Procedures and ReportsAlthough some flexibility is acceptable, a major part of this position requires in-house hands-on lab tasking.Required Education, Experience, & SkillsBachelor's Degree in Software Engineering or related engineering field and 6+ years of experience in related field, 4+ years with Master’s DegreeStrong communication skills to collaborate with team members and stakeholdersExperience in performing software and systems integration and testingExperience with issue tracking systemsExperience with Agile developmentTeam player with proactive attitude and the ability to be productive in a dynamic/collaborative environment.Able to obtain DOD Top Secret ClearancePreferred Education, Experience, & Skills Experience with containerization technologies (Kubernetes or Docker) and container orchestration platforms (e.g., Rancher or Docker Swarm)Knowledge of Linux/Unix OS systems administration and troubleshootingRF, Radar, EO/IR, Electronic Warfare, SIGINT or Software Defined Radio experienceExperience designing, writing, testing, integrating, and debugging open architecture SWExperience writing test plans, procedures, schedules and reports in accordance with program and system requirementsThe development of user stories, backlog prioritization and management, technical documentation, sprint planning, resource management and customer engagement.Proficiency with Agile management tools (e.g., Jira, etc.)Experience developing test tools using Matlab and/or PythonCurrently holds Secret or Top Secret DOD ClearancePay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $112420 - $191070Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve. At BAE Systems, we celebrate the array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We’re laser-focused on high performance, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. Here, you will not only build your career, but you will also enjoy work-life balance, uncover new experiences, and collaborate with passionate colleagues.

title: Chief Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description Ready to make a difference? BAE Systems is looking for a Chief Engineer to work as and lead a cross-functional, multi-disciplinary team to design, integrate, debug, test, and deliver next generation EW systems. Focused on delivering innovative Electronic Warfare (EW) solutions, individual technical contributions on a related range of Programs will include system development, requirements development, integration & test, and test planning and execution in a field deployment environment. As a Chief Engineer responsibilities may include: * Leads a multidisciplinary team of engineers on EW related programs. Leads one of more of the following systems engineering functions: Reviews, develops and documents system level operational concepts and mission statements. Develops and evaluates system designs and architectures. Leads system level integration and test of systems. Verifies and validates system designs to ensure conformance with functional specifications and customer requirements. Supports proposal development activities, including proposal text development, cost estimating and presentation activities. Preparing and deliver customer and technical presentations. Will have multiple contacts with customers, other contractors and government officials. Performs systems engineering functions such as developing and managing systems level requirements, developing operational systems concepts, performing system architecture trade studies, originating design concepts or performing systems level integration and test for complex systems. * Expected to independently formulate and implement system solutions. Support to factory operations to ensure on time delivery of the highest quality products.This position will require you to be onsite in either Nashua NH or Manchester NH. Because of the need for consistent, in-person collaboration and/or the requirement to perform all work onsite due to the nature of this particular role, it will be performed full-time on site. This means work will be conducted on location at a BAE Systems facility 100% of the time. See what you're missing. Electronic Combat Solutions has technology, engineering and program teams that educate and mentor colleagues to deliver leading Electronic Warfare capabilities. We welcome all those who have big ideas, crave innovation, want to drive fielding velocity and have the passion to bring the warfighter home safe. With a 9/80 schedule, and every other Friday off, our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first - exemplified by our mission: "We Protect Those Who Protect Us®." Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems. Required Education, Experience, & Skills * Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent experience in a relevant field) with a minimum work experience of:8+ Years with BS6+ Years with MS4+ Year with PHD * Possess an Active US Government security clearance (with ability to possess TS) Leadership skills and experience directing and mentoring engineers on complex programs Experience in effectively documenting, communicating, leading and working with a team on designs, results, reports, and presentations. Experience performing systems engineering activities across the development cycle (analysis/decomposition/derivation/allocation of requirements, system modeling & simulation, system design & development, system integration & test) through production Experience developing viable concept solutions, identifying and tracking technical risks, and leading technical teams Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills * M.S. in Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering or a related engineering discipline Experience with EW and/or Radar and Missile Systems Experience with technical performance measurements and control account management Model based systems engineering experience with tools such as MagicDraw Active United States security clearance, Top Secret, SCI Eligible Pay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $140690 - $239140 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it's what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts - defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team-making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you'll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems' game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere - from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact - for our customers and the communities we serve. Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

title: VP, Regional Small Business Leader
job_description: Company DetailsFounded in 1967, W. R. Berkley Corporation has grown from a small investment management firm into one of the largest commercial lines property and casualty insurers in the United States.Along the way, we’ve been listed on the New York Stock Exchange, become a Fortune 500 Company, joined the S&P 500, and seen our gross written premiums exceed $10 billion.Today the Berkley brand comprises more than 50 businesses worldwide and is divided into two segments: Insurance and Reinsurance & Monoline Excess. Led by our Executive Chairman, founder and largest shareholder, William. R. Berkley and our President and Chief Executive Officer, W. Robert Berkley, Jr., W.R. Berkley Corporation is well-positioned to respond to opportunities for future growth. #Guidewire #commercialinsuranceThis role will be based in one of our offices in New England (specifically CT, MA, ME or NH). We offer a hybrid work schedule with 4 days in the office; and 1 day remote where it makes sense to do so.The company is an equal opportunity employer.ResponsibilitiesThe VP, Small Commercial plays a critical role in the development and execution of WRBC’s Regional small business strategy in support of the companies that operate across the continental U.S. This role collaborates closely with senior leadership to build customer personas, deliver market differentiators, provide technical expertise, and foster alignment between business and technology. This leader provides a shared vision of the future, ensuring companies can profitability grow their small business portfolio, expand their appetites, leverage common platforms, maximize operational efficiencies, and provide a superior customer experience.We'll Count On You ToImplement a fully integrated digital solution that provides a simple, seamless experience and meets our agents where they do business. Provide regional companies with resources to help market and sell new digital platforms and capabilities to their associates, agents, and insureds.Lead the design of insurance products and technology platforms that enable efficiency in the quote/bind/issue space.Develop underwriting rules that streamline automation and straight through processing (STP) in support of growth and profitability objectives.Serve as a liaison and escalation point for underwriting staff on system integrations, product, operations, analytics, appetite, and referrals.Collaborate with our business partners to grow and constantly improve the business portfolio:Professionals at our regional companies that effectively develop and underwrite the business with our agency partners.Actuarial and data scientist teams to create world-class pricing stratification.Operations team to develop streamlined workflows, with data and metrics regarding STP, turnaround time, referral triggers, issuance, and endorsements.Be a thought leader for expansion within small commercial:Collaborate with regional companies and conduct market analysis to identify potential industry expansion.Create go to market strategy for new industry segments including marketing, training, communications, and underwriting guidelines.Maintain the portfolio business in a profitable manner.Collaborate with technology partners to enable products for digital agency distribution.Enhance product solutions for book consolidation opportunities.QualificationsWhat you need to have:Bachelor's degree from four-year College or UniversityStrong insurance industry knowledge and underwriting acumen10+ years of experience in the small commercial insurance business strategy and eco-system developmentAbility to travel 25%Excellent communication, for full time regular employees.The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment.
