title: Assistant Rating Specialist
job_description: Amwins Program Underwriters  is looking for a Rating Specialist to join our team in Portsmouth. This position provides a full range of rating of Property and Casualty insurance policies and endorsements per program underwriting guidelines, internal standards and deadlines.The successful candidate will possess a vibrant personality, excellent communication skills, great motivation, capacity to understand concepts and drive to succeed in a team environment. We are looking for individuals who can bring their unique value to our team.Job Duties And Responsibilities Reviews New Business/Renewal applications, renewal instructions, and requests for policy changes to verify all pertinent information to produce accurate quotes, policies, and endorsements  Obtain missing rating information by utilizing all resources provided (i.e. ISO fire rates & rules, Sage, internet, co-workers etc.)  Perform calculations to produce accurate and timely quotes and premium charges by using carrier rating systems, and other rating sources provided by company  Maintain rating manuals  Review and implement carrier bulletins and release notes  Manage own work assignments to meet the company’s service standards and delivery metrics Essential Knowledge And Training Knowledge of property and casualty insurance coverages and rating principals  Must be proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel  Possess excellent communication skills, be able to take direction from multiple sources (Underwriters, supervisors, and other senior positions) and handle multiple priorities  Must be able to work under minimal supervision and frequently exercise initiative, independent judgment and problem solving skills  Attention to details is critical for this position Work Experience 2-3 years of rating and/or commercial insurance experience Other Requirements Associate’s, Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent preferred  Certificate in General Insurance (AINS – Intro, Ethics, INS21, INS22, INS23) or ability to obtain one within a year No direct inquiries, please.

title: General Laborer
job_description: Who we are:FleetGenius, LLC, is the leading national company focused on providing total life-cycle sustainable container solutions to its customers. On behalf of its customers, FleetGenius, manages both plastic and steel cart inventories, delivery, retrieval and repairs, as well as warranty management and end of life recycling. FleetGenius is a paperless company, and all work actions are recorded electronically.Job Position: General LaborerJob Type: Full-TimePay: WEEKLY PAYPayrate: $19.00 per hourSchedule: 6:30am-3:00 pm Monday-FridayGeneral Laborer description various tasks include but not limited to:Helping Welding Technicians prepare waste containers to be repaired.Torch burningAssisting Lead fabricator when necessaryPrepping the metal waste containers to be painted including grinding flaking paint and rust.Painting the metal waste containers after they were repaired using an airless Paint SprayerHelp maintain the cleanliness of the shop, office and grounds.With good work performance this position could lead to learning a skilled trade (Welding) for the right person!A current driver's license is preferred but not required.Requirements:Requires Lifting, pushing, pulling up to 75 pounds.Ability to stand and bend for extended periods of time.Experience using a handheld grinder (preferred)What We Offer:Benefits become effective on the first of the month after hire.Work gear and personal protection equipment are supplied.Great working environment with a positive atmosphere with room for advancement.Benefits:Medical Insurance (Health Savings Account Option)Dental InsuranceVision InsuranceHealth-Care Flexible Spending AccountVoluntary and Company-Paid Term Life/AD&D Insurance401(k) Savings Plan with Company match after one-year of serviceTeam member discountPaid holidays, vacation, and sick days.Voluntary Short-term and Long-Term disabilityVoluntary Critical Illness and Accident Insurance  Work Location: 209 Nashua Rd., Londonderry, NH 03053

title: Transportation Analytics Specialist
job_description: VF Corporation outfits consumers around the world with its diverse portfolio of iconic lifestyle brands, including Vans®, The North Face®, Timberland®, Dickies®. Founded in 1899, VF is one of the world’s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies with socially and environmentally responsible operations spanning numerous geographies, product categories and distribution channels. We’re committed to delivering innovative products to consumers and creating long-term value for our customers and shareholders.Powerful brands that are fueled by insights and innovation put us at the heart of our consumers’ lives. Many of our brands lead their respective categories, and some have risen to iconic status.While our company and brands are diverse, we work together within a One VF culture to capitalize on our greatest opportunities for long-term performance. Across our company, a collaborative, global mindset differentiates our products and the unique experiences we provide to our consumers. It all adds up to a lasting competitive advantage built on harnessing the power of our differences to achieve great things together, all while positively impacting the lives of hundreds of millions of people and the world.Freight Audit/ Payment Coordinator: Become the Newest Member of the VF Family The Sr. Specialist is responsible for the receipt, organization, audit and processing of all freight invoices from the carriers of all VF brands, resolving exception invoice inquiries, as well as supporting the management of FA/P for ad hoc reporting and projects. This position will also be responsible to act as a back-up for other team members of VF Freight Audit/Payment as required.How You Will Make a Difference:  Ability to resolve invoice exceptions with carriers thru the understanding of the coding and processing of all invoice systems (WD, Kipling, Cass, GTNexus, SAP).  Run reports from the CassPort Business Analytics tool for Logistics team and Finance team requests. Working closely with carriers to enhance their processing by formatting, providing correct data and submitting electronically. Create upload files for both SAP Winshuttle and Cass for various carrier exceptions. Assist in month-end Finance reporting with accruals, reclasses and ad hoc requests. Work closely with carriers to resolve invoices on monthly outstanding statements. Monitor the parcel accounts in Cass to be sure all are authorized and set up correctly. Skills for Success: Years of Related Professional Experience: 2+ yearsEducational/ Position Requirements:Associate’s degree or higher preferred. Advanced computer skills with above average proficiency with spreadsheets. Working knowledge of general ledger (GL) accounting codes. Basic knowledge of transportation modes (ocean, air, truck, etc.) and logistics processes. Strong attention to detail and organization skills. Strong communication (written and verbal). Ability to build strategic work relationships and trust across departments. Ability to meet deadlines and adjust to changing requirements. Commitment to help drive change and results. Ability to work independently. Special Physical and/or Mental Requirements: Ability to work in an office environment with office equipment such as computers and handle pressures of deadlines. Hiring Range:$24.00 USD - $30.00 USD per hourIncentive Potential: This position is eligible for additional compensation awards that may include an annual incentive plan, sales incentive, or commission potential. Specific details of the additional compensation eligibility for this position will be provided during the recruiting and interview process.Benefits at VF Corporation: You can review a general overview of each benefit program offered, including this year's medical plan rates on www.MyVFbenefits.com and by clicking Looking to Join VF? Detailed information on your benefits will be provided during the hiring process.Please note, our hiring ranges are determined and built from market pay data. In determining the specific compensation for this position, we comply with all local, state, and federal laws.At VF, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual’s race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. If you are unable to submit your application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at peopleservices@vfc.com. VF will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law.Pursuant to all applicable local Fair Chance Ordinance requirements, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, VF will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: Tier 2 Detection and Response Analyst
job_description: Together we fight for everyone’s opportunity for a better financial future.We will do this together — with customers, partners and colleagues. We will fight for others, not against: We will stand up for and champion everyone’s access to opportunities. The status quo is not good enough … we believe every individual and every community deserves access to financial opportunities. We are determined to support both individuals and communities in reaching a better financial future. We know that reaching this future depends on our actions today.Like our Purpose Statement, Voya believes in being bold and committed to action. We are committed to a work environment where the differences that we are born with — and those we acquire throughout our lives — are understood, valued and intentionally pursued. We believe that our employees own our culture and have a responsibility to foster an environment where we all feel comfortable bringing our whole selves to work. Purposefully bringing our differences together to positively influence our culture, serve our clients and enrich our communities is essential to our vision.Are you ready to join a company with a strong purpose and a winning culture? Start your Voyage – Apply NowGet To Know The OpportunityThis position is for a Tier 2 Detection and Response Analyst. As a member of the Detection and Response Team (DART) you will handle escalations from Tier 1 analysts working to analyze, contain, and eradicate potential cyber threats to the organization.You will play a key role in the detection engineering process while working with other highly skilled team members on both the offensive and defensive spectrums. This includes analyzing and dissecting techniques utilized by threat actors, understanding where best detection opportunities lie, identifying potential monitoring gaps, and configuring detections to defend the organization. The role will also have the opportunity to work in and help mature other areas such as threat hunting and automation (SOAR).The Contributions You Will MakeUses security monitoring tools to investigate, respond to, and recommend appropriate corrective actions for data security incidentsParticipates with development, maintenance, and testing of security alerts covering a wide range of operating systems, services, and applicationsProvide a technical resource and escalation point for Tier 1 analystsCollaborate with other SOC analysts and take initiative to hunt for undetected or abnormal threat activity.Produce high quality oral and written presentations, communicating complex technical matters clearly and concisely with audiences ranging from peers to senior managementDevelops and assists in maintenance of standard operating procedures to ensure security is in compliance with policies and standardsPart of a scheduled on-call rotationOther duties as assignedMinimum Knowledge & ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a directly related field with 2-3 years of professional experienceKnowledge of and hands-on experience with security monitoring tools such as SIEM and EDRExperience in security aspects of multiple platforms, operating systems, software, communications, and network protocolsRequires excellent analytical ability, consultative and communication skills, and strong judgementSelf-motivated with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple deliverablesCompensation Pay DisclosureVoya is committed to pay that’s fair and equitable, which means comparable pay for comparable roles and responsibilities.The below annual base salary range reflects the expected hiring range(s) for this position in the location(s) listed. In addition to base salary, Voya offers incentive opportunities (i.e., annual cash incentives, sales incentives, and/or long-term incentives) based on the role to reward the achievement of annual performance objectives. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Voya Financial is willing to pay at the time of this posting.Actual compensation offered may vary from the posted salary range based upon the candidate’s geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.$67,700 - $112,850 USDBe Well. Stay Well.Voya provides the resources that can make a difference in your lives. To us, this means thriving physically, financially, socially and emotionally. Voya benefits are designed to help you do just that. That’s why we offer an array of plans, programs, tools and resources with one goal in mind: To help you and your family be well and stay well.What We OfferHealth, dental, vision and life insurance plans401(k) Savings plan – with generous company matching contributions (up to 6%)Voya Retirement Plan – employer paid cash balance retirement plan (4%)Tuition reimbursement up to $5,250/yearPaid time off – including 20 days paid time off, nine paid company holidays and a flexible Diversity Celebration Day.Paid volunteer time — 40 hours per calendar yearLearn More About Voya Benefits (download PDF)Critical SkillsAt Voya, we have identified the following critical skills which are key to success in our culture:Customer Focused: Passionate drive to delight our customers and offer unique solutions that deliver on their expectations.Critical Thinking: Thoughtful process of analyzing data and problem solving data to reach a well-reasoned solution.Team Mentality: Partnering effectively to drive our culture and execute on our common goals. Business Acumen: Appreciation and understanding of the financial services industry in order to make sound business decisions.Learning Agility: Openness to new ways of thinking and acquiring new skills to retain a competitive advantage.Learn More About Critical SkillsEqual Employment OpportunityVoya Financial is an equal-opportunity employer. Voya Financial provides equal opportunity to qualified individuals regardless of race, color, sex, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, disability, veteran status, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other status protected by state or local law.Reasonable AccommodationsVoya is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Voya will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please reference resources for applicants with disabilities.Misuse of Voya's name in fraud schemes

title: Field Service Engineer / CNC Machine Repair
job_description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking customer focused professionals with a positive attitude and a passion for problem solving to join our superior service team!As a representative of our company internally and externally, you will be part of our Service Team installing brand new machine tools and repairing and maintaining existing machines at our customers’ facilities throughout all six New England states.You will also work in our facility customizing the latest, most advanced CNC machine tools on the market today prior to shipping out to customers.Why work here:Competitive wagesGenerous Health and Wellness BenefitsCompany vehicle provided (well taken care of and maintained)Per diem for overnight jobsCore Activities:You will be factory trained to work on the brands of machines we sell, and we will support you in keeping up to date with new machine products and service issue. With that, you will set up new machines and install options on new and other in-service equipment for our customers. Travel with a company vehicle to customer locations to maintain, trouble shoot issues, test, and keep customer’s equipment functioning properly. You will comply with customer safety requirements, maintain good customer relationships, and strive for customer satisfaction. You will also inform the customer of all work being performed. As needed, you will provide phone support and train customers to maintain and operate machinery. Help develop written procedures for installation of machine accessories, options, and field installed items. Assist other employees with service projects. Complete all reports and paperwork in an organized and timely manner. Assist with setup for trade shows and open house events. Maintain all work tools and equipment used during the service process while keeping the area tidy and safe. Maintain and care for assigned company vehicle, having good driving record, as required by our service guidelines. Maintain a professional manner and appearance as outlined in service guidelines. Company DescriptionABLE Machine Tool Sales has aided our customers in pushing the limits of their production since 1987. As one of New England’s leading CNC machine tool distributors, we are focused on keeping our customers successful by providing them with the latest state-of-the-art equipment and supporting them with timely service and applications expertise.ABLE Machine Tool Sales has aided our customers in pushing the limits of their production since 1987. As one of New England’s leading CNC machine tool distributors, we are focused on keeping our customers successful by providing them with the latest state-of-the-art equipment and supporting them with timely service and applications expertise.

title: Flight Attendant
job_description: The Thermo Fisher Scientific Corporate Flight Department seeks an experienced, enthusiastic Flight Attendant to join our aviation team based in Portsmouth, NH (KPSM)! You have a positive demeanor and are willing to take on additional responsibilities to provide an outstanding experience for our passengers. You present a professional image and deliver extraordinary service while maintaining corporate confidentiality regarding all aspects of the flight operations.Job SummaryThe flight attendant works as a crew member, under the direction of the pilot in command. Primary responsibilities are the safety and comfort of the passengers carried aboard company aircraft. The primary duties include greeting passengers, demonstrating the use of safety equipment, serving gourmet catering with various beverages, and managing Cabin Connectivity.Job ResponsibilitiesEnsures that cabin and safety equipment meet specified standards prior to each flight.Appropriately briefs passengers on all required items and provides clear instructions to them during normal and emergency operations.Participates in the preflight safety briefing with the crew.Responsible for handling cabin service and passenger accommodations including food and beverage service in accordance with the established service guidelines.Ensures that catering and supplies, including blankets, bedding, reading material, emergency equipment, and other supplies are on board and are in adequate supply for the trip and number of passengers.Maintains a detailed knowledge of all appropriate rules and regulations that pertain to the flight attendants’ role in the department.Maintains a thorough, solid understanding of all safety equipment, passenger comfort items and communication and entertainment systems on board the aircraft.Ensures aircraft is cleaned and stocked prior to and after each flight.Completes supplemental assignments and administrative responsibilities in a timely and accurate manner.Successfully complete all assigned training.Works collaboratively within the department to establish and maintain a safety culture consistent with the safety management system and industry best practices.Works closely with other Flight Department members to ensure effective communication and coordination among all personnel groups to support the department’s goals and objectives.Fosters an atmosphere of trust, support and respect by modeling behavior that embodies Thermo Fisher’s 4 I Values.Qualifications:Must be highly experienced as a corporate flight attendantHold a valid U.S. passport and ability to travel internationally without restrictionsValid driver’s licenseCPR/AED/First Aid Training CertificationFlight attendant specific training from FlightSafety or FACTS (12 months current)Experience on corporate, large cabin aircraftExcellent interpersonal and customer service skillsMust be technologically savvy, with a working knowledge of cabin communication and entertainment systems;Computer literacy; MS Office, iOS, iPads, etc.Ability to physically perform the duties required during normal and emergency operations, including lifting heavy objectsAble to maintain a flexible schedule, work weekends, and holidays and be away from home for an extended periodMeet all health and safety requirements established by the Corporate Flight DepartmentDomiciled within 2 hours of KPSMInternational experience as a flight attendant on corporate aircraftExperience working on Gulfstream aircraft

title: Program Associate
job_description: Who We AreCampus Compact for New Hampshire (CCNH) is a nonprofit higher education consortium that works to improve learning and strengthen communities by integrating service and civic responsibility throughout college life.CCNH collaborates with the New Hampshire College & University Council and other community and business partners to administer high-impact initiatives such as GEAR UP, New Hampshire Scholars, and AmeriCorps VISTA. These and other initiatives help students succeed in school while providing millions of dollars in services in areas like education, environmental sustainability, health care, poverty, food insecurity, and more.The OpportunityThe NH-SFEC Program Associate is a full-time, grant-funded position that will report directly to the Project Director of the NH-SFEC, and will work directly with Program Coordinators, school districts, and community partners to implement trainings, convenings, and events related to Family Engagement across the birth-postsecondary ages centered in Dr. Karen Mapp's dual capacity model and Dr. Joyce Epstein's six types of family involvement frameworks.Position Knowledge, Skills And AbilitiesTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each primary duty satisfactorily. The requirements of the position are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required, with regular and predictable attendance essential. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Create and maintain processes to manage program files, including service reports and grant documentation.Clerical support for regional grant activities such as coordinating supply purchases, printing, and data collection. Support the Program Coordinators in the creation and distribution of electronic and paper communications to schools, parents, and program participants. Maintain electronic files for information sharing; set-up folders, maintain calendars, and other documentation.Review purchase requests and travel requests prior to Project Director approval; collaborate with Finance department to ensure expenses are allowable, reasonable and necessary to meet program goals & objectives. Collaborate with Program Coordinators and others regarding grant management/development, and operational needs. Process, review, and submit data reports on behalf of program activities. Schedule and prepare SFEC meetings; disseminate agenda and provide onsite meeting support, such as registration and taking minutes. Represent the NH-SFEC and partner organizations at in-person and virtual events across NH. Provide event management assistance in the form of set up, coordination, and breakdown with events involving program staff and families. Position QualificationsEducation required to ensure success in this position:Associate degree or 3-5 years of relevant professional experience.Desired Experience Required To Ensure Success In This PositionThree years of experience providing direct services to families and/or children.Experience performing clerical and logistical duties in an office environmentEvent management and promotion experienceFluency in a language other than English commonly spoken in NH (Spanish, French, Nepali, Arabic, and/or Swahili).Required Skills, Knowledge, And AbilitiesProficiency working within all Microsoft Office applications, including SharePoint and One Drive, and ability to operate software on a variety of platforms. Proficiency with communications and event management software such as Eventbrite, Mail Chimp, and Constant Contact. Strong organizational skills and a demonstrated ability to multi-task efficiently. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with a variety of stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with others. Must maintain confidentiality and protect the private nature of files and conversations; possess mature judgment and display positive attitude.A commitment to serving students, families, and staff from diverse economic, social, and cultural backgrounds.Capacity to multi-task and achieve deadlines on multiple ongoing projects.Demonstrated commitment to inclusively serving and working with communities and families from a diversity of background and experiences, and sensitivity needed to work respectfully across differences.License, certifications necessaryValid drivers' licenseAbility to successfully complete pre-employment background check.Physical RequirementsAbility to work within both office and remote work settings. Ability to accurately communicate and exchange information with partners, stakeholders, and/or meeting participants. Ability to occasionally lift up to 20 lbs.Ability to travel independently by car and plane regionally and nationally. Environmental ConditionsRoutine office environment with interruptions and noise.Approximately 25% of time may consist of travel to meetings and/or program partner sites within the service area. Other regional and national travel is sometimes required.Ability To Operate The Following Vehicles Or EquipmentStandard Office Equipment: computer, fax, phone, office software.Vehicle (as needed)Salary and BenefitsCompetitive salary $40,000Paid holiday and vacation timeHealth, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life InsuranceGenerous 401K PlanHybrid Position: must be able to work in our Concord, NH based officeCore ValuesCCNH is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, disability, sex (including sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression), age, marital status, military or veteran status, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. We strive to create an equitable, inclusive workplace where everyone feels a strong sense of belonging.CCNH believes in fair and equitable pay. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, and business need.At CCNH, our team is creative, hardworking, fun loving, and passionate about what we do. We pride ourselves on our entrepreneurial spirit and inclusive culture. We conduct our work with a set of core values that include integrity, respect, creativity, kindness, innovation, and excellence.Salary: $40000 per yearJob Posted by ApplicantPro
